Florian Zeller is to be congratulated for his brilliant trick of playing with the audience's perceptions of who is who, where is where and even when is when, in order to offer some insight into what the world must feel like for someone descending into dementia. He should also be congratulated for the unflinchingly unsentimental treatment of the story. We are presented with the pain, sorrow, conflicted emotions and occasional flashes of humour that make up the "loved one with dementia" experience - sadly, one with which all too many people are familiar - without any overt attempts to manipulate our emotions or tell us how to think. "The Father" is a totally absorbing drama, and Anthony Hopkins (cast - almost disturbingly so - as a man called Anthony) inhabits the role with absolute conviction and believability, supported by a superb ensemble of top-notch talent.Without wishing to rain on its parade, though, I would raise a couple of points of detail re. The care of patients with dementia:1) In the final scene of the film, which takes place in a (clearly very expensive) care home, none of the staff is wearing a name-badge. They should be. It helps the patients keep some kind of grip on who is who in their lives.2) In the same scene, Anthony tries to describe how he is feeling. "I feel as if I'm losing all my leaves," he says - to which the nurse replies "What do you mean?" WRONG: no trained dementia nurse would ever say such a thing to a patient. If the patient were able to assemble the words to express themself more clearly, they would do so, and requiring them to explain what they mean only heightens their distress and anxiety. I'm surprised that this slip-up was not spotted and removed from what is an otherwise excellent script.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My grandfather struggled with dementia for the last few years of his life, and this movie helps me understand his experience and struggles so much better. I am blown away with how moving and incredible this movie was. This is a film everybody should watch. Motion Pictures like this are the reason I love film.Edit: I just saw the news tonight about Anthony Hopkins getting his second Oscar. I think this is one of the most well deserved Oscar wins I have seen. Although he will probably never see this, I would like to thank Anthony for providing his incredible acting. It was one of the most heart wrenching things I have watched and it means so much to me. The Oscar is definitely an incredible accolade for Anthony, but most importantly, this is a performance that I know will touch the hearts of many as it did mine.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
See it.Brilliant acting
Hopkins at the top of his game
Brilliant script
Genius director.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Beautifully acted, written, directed and very well paced. I can't understand why it hasn't won more Oscar's. Who am I kidding? Academy Awards have become a sham now.This movie is one of those that will go down in history as one of those classics that everyone agrees to be a masterpiece.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Thank you, Anthony Hopkins, for giving me an eternal fear of forgetting everyone and everything I hold dear.I just cried so much. What a heartbreaking story, backed by amazing cast.I'm just gonna go to my bed and cry, if you don't mind.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie was perfect: the directing, acting, script, editing... everything! It's so impressive how drastic changes happens all the time and it seems so smooth the way it flows, perfect directing! The film is also powerful and real, everyone that has someone in the family with Alzheimer will relate with it a lot. One of the best movies. I love it, decent 8/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: "The Father" is nothing short of a heartbreaking film, about an elderly man suffering from dementia. Throughout the film, you are shown the perspective of Anthony, the dementia patient with characters appearing and disappearing (e.g. His son-in-law) not to mention dialogue that contradicts what was said before (e.g. His daughter denying that she was going to move to Paris despite her saying that she would earlier in the film). This creates confusion in the audience, which is the intended effect. I think this movie is a great way of showing people what dementia is like and just how horrible it can be.As for negatives, I honestly can't think of any. The performances were all brilliant (especially Anthony Hopkins'), the cinematography, editing, music etc. All fit together really nicely to create an immersive, unforgettable, and saddening experience.So, to conclude, watch this movie if you're fine with watching an extremely well-made yet depressing movie that you won't forget any time soon.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is phenonmenal. 100% better than the marvel star

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What a beautifully constructed film. The intricate film-making creates such an immersive experience, the audience real delve into the life of the characters, which in this case is quite a heart-breaking place to be, despite its striking reality. This is especially effective in such a contained setting, which is just one of the many brilliant directorial decisions made in The Father.You see this is really a very simple film. There are only a few characters, which gives more room for each to be fully fleshed out, which allows us to engage with each person and their role in the story a lot more. The narrative is told somewhat in a linear manor but fuddled up and moved around to reflect the state of mind of Anthony Hopkins' character (sort of similar to that of Memento) and that's it. Only that isn't it, although technically so little is done so much effect is made, this story benefits so much from simplicity because there we have so much. So much raw emotion and so much heart-breaking realism. You really feel like you are in this world firstly as a viewer, but then you begin to question yourself and your own perception and sense of being and when everything becomes clear at the end of the film you instead think of the people around you and not yourself. You think of those close to you, your family or anyone who is slowly losing touch with themselves and the world around them, only able to hold onto a few fragments of their memories. And that hits you like a ton of bricks.I watched this with two of my friends in the cinema a few weeks ago and all of our reactions when the film had finished was around the lines of "I want to call my Mum... I want to check up on my Grandad. ... I miss ...". That's impact for you. I think that gives you plenty of reason to watch this film if you are emotionally stable enough to be taken through the ringer quite a bit. But oh my what a beautifully tragic piece of cinema.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: There are many reasons that this film is one that I one would consider a must see. The still frames in this movie are painted like wonderful paintings. Beautiful contrast and detail in each shot.The acting is so incredible, and the the way the dialogue is nuanced and reveals the true details of the dementia as well as how they tell this through visual storytelling is masterful.The range of emotions and ability to transition the entire mood, tone, and pacing of the scene with or without music is masterful. It almost feels like you are seeing it as a play.The flow of the scenes is impeccable, and there are moments that make your gut sink. Truly an incredible piece of cinema and a worthwhile watch.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I think that this is one of the best movie of the last 20 years. You can really explore the dementia sufferer's mind: it's possible to watch the world from his perspective.Anthony Hopkins had one of his best performance ever and Olivia Colman supports him magnificently.The emotions that made me feel are such that I can't not give a 9.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film takes you through the mind of ab old man with amnesia. It's 100% thought provoking.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The father is a great drama with a great performance by the cast. Obviously age is just a number for Anthony Hopkins the man is a true legend other cast members are great as well but Imogen Poots could have been better, really good cinematography, other than some minor plot holes I saw nothing wrong with this movie and I absolutely liked it and highly recommend watching it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm not usually a big fan of movies adapted from stage plays, because the very nature of writing for the theatre places the audience's focus on dialogue, structure and performance, and I'm more of a visuals and music guy when it comes to movies. I can appreciate sharp writing but I need the extra zest of overall fine filmmaking to bring an adaptation above and beyond the theatre. I tend to be more forgiving if a beautiful looking and great sounding movie is relatively lacking in plot or dialogue, versus the opposite (a movie with great writing, but technically bland).I'm a big fan of Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman, but the potentially sensitive subject of dementia, and the fact that this was adapted from a play by a director who was making his screen directorial debut, had me worried. Would it be as stodgy or emotionally manipulative as it could have been? The material might have worked well on stage but would it as cinema?In that regard I was pleasantly surprised. Clearly this was a play, because it is indeed driven by the dialogue and character interactions, and almost entirely set indoors. But Florian Zeller provides some nice cinematic touches that help to raise the experience, mainly in three ways. One, his use of music. The few classical pieces here come in at just the right moments and are extremely effective whenever they do. I suspect that the music was also part of the stage production, because it's important to the protagonist's characterization; listening to music is Anthony's favored escape from reality. But here, the soundtrack fits the movie like a glove and gives it more dynamism. Two, Zeller's cinematographer, Ben Smithard, a veteran of numerous films and shows, vividly captures both the indoor and outdoor environments, most notably the main flat that contains most of the "action." The apartment complex becomes its own character, in a way, as the viewer gets to know its geography and objects. Credit must also go to the production and set designers, of course. Three, and probably most importantly, you have the excellent work by Greek film editor Yorgos Lamprinos. I haven't seen anything else he has done, but his editing here is a huge part of what makes this material translate so well as a movie. He was deservedly nominated for an Oscar.But those are all factors that personally made this such an excellent film for ME. Of course, the main draws here for most people will be Anthony Hopkins and the writing, by an award-winning playwright. And those things are as strong as you've heard. The writing is witty, unpredictable and, by the end, poignant, as you enter the frayed mind of Anthony while he deals with encroaching dementia. Zeller's treatment of such a sensitive subject is refreshingly free of sentimentality or emotional manipulation. This is pitched almost as much like a Hitchcockian mystery as it is a drama of old age and family, and the pacing is fantastic; at a tight 97 minutes, it never overstays its welcome or drags. As is typical of great writing, the script drops only as much detail as it needs to throughout, while leaving just enough lingering questions in the viewers' minds. And beware, not all of those questions will be answered. Even after the end credits begin rolling, you will need to interpret certain plot points in your own way, and there is a lot of fodder for discussion and debate here. My partner and I couldn't agree on what really transpired in the family's past. It frustrated her, but I loved the ambiguity.Hopkins is simply amazing here. He brings humor, anger, sadness, irascibility, strength and fragility in one fully formed and complex package of a character. He's such a natural in the role that I assumed he originated the part on stage. So It was to my surprise that I found out that not only was this film Hopkins's first time playing "Anthony," but the play was originally in French and therefore began life with a French lead in the role. Christopher Hampton, the translator, rightly receives a co-writing credit because he is a large part of why the English dialogue still crackled so well. Anybody would think it was the original language. The immensely talented Olivia Colman holds her own as the titular character's loving yet conflicted daughter, but this is mainly Hopkins's show and he is absolutely engrossing every second he's on the screen. And it's not just his facial expressions and line delivery either; it's a surprisingly physical performance; the viewer can easily gleam Anthony's varying moods and emotions merely from his body language (and he shows off some dance moves too). I haven't yet seen the late Chadwick Boseman in Ma Rainey's Black Bottom, but after witnessing Hopkins's incredible work here, I can't imagine anyone else more deserving of the Best Actor Oscar. Mads Mikkelsen for Another Round, maybe, but he somehow wasn't even nominated.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's so uncommon for an actor of Hopkins' talent and reputation to achieve quite possibly the best performance of his career so deep into it. He's acted brilliantly for so long and I don't mean to undermine anything he's ever accomplished in the past, but normally by now actors start phoning it in. But wow. He was not.This film was devastating to watch. In the best way possible. From the acting - which was lead by Hopkins but was not just great because of him! - to the writing, directing, scoring, editing, cinematography on and on and on everything was amazing! The only reason I did not give it a perfect 10/10 is because I so rarely give them out I'm afraid to act too rashly and give it out too soon but trust me... I may end up doing just that.As someone who has experienced the subject matter of this film personally in my family I cannot express how painfully accurate every little detail was in the writing and in Hopkins' beautiful performance. The confusion, the anger, the regret, the brutal honesty and lack of self awareness, the fear, the bipolar nature was all so frighteningly accurate that I forgot many times that I was watching a film not a documentary or even real life.I don't say this lightly.. this may not only be the best film of the past year but of the past decade. Absolutely amazing.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father is an absolute masterpiece and deserves all the accolades that it's getting. Anthony Hopkins gives the best performance in his career. This is a film that stays with you.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Give Anthony Hopkins the Oscar on April 26. He gives you the best performance of the decade. An old man with dementia loses his ties to reality. His mind deteriorates, and reality stops making any sense. This movie will haunt you, especially if you have a relative with dementia. Such a heartbreaking movie. ABSOLUTELY the best movie of the year and the best performance of the year by Hopkins.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My favorite movie of the year. Anthony Hopkins does one of the best performance i've ever seen. The cinematography and directing is perfect. By the ending scene I wasn't able to cry because I was so awed by Hopkin's performance.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If I'm honest I didn't want to watch this movie. I'm an action fan, people blowing stuff up car chases loud noises that kinda thing. This was my wife's choice and as I'm a good husband I dutifully went along. And I'm so glad I did. All of the performances were spot on. Olivia Colman never lets me down in anything she's done and her performance as Anne is fantastic. But the real star and rightly so is Sir Anthony Hopkins. His performance as the titular Father is just magnificent. The film itself is at times so moving and at others so hard but it kept me guessing right up to the end. It's a must watch movie, maybe not a big screen movie but a must watch all the same. 9 out of ten.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: After experiencing the downfall of my father myself at close hand to this hideous condition ....I'm so glad someone has realistically portrayed if only by a fraction the hurt and horror .i applaud you for observations ,a true horror film which is sometimes the life we live . A new benchmark in film on this subject imho.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Really powerful, it really hit me hard, seeing this family struggling with memory loss, confusion and some backstory. The acting is amazing, emotions feel real and it's even stronger when you personally know someone with Alzheimer's.Kinda disappointed with the soundtrack, which is good but was sold like a masterpiece. But like I said, it's good.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I love Anthony Hopkins from the first time I saw him in The silence of the lambs.Amazing performance, very good movie , very very moving and touching.Worth to watch it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: No words for this unbelievably incredible performance . Just hand him all the awards academy!!!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Don't come into this movie thinking you've seen it all. It's not an easy watch /: Hermit crabs love their flats.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Simple stories & good actors. Simply it's real, believable, short & sad but you will never regret watching it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father is a difficult film to review. It is not an easy film to watch, but it is not an exploitative trauma film like so many other movies and shows out there right now. In some ways, The Father is the scariest horror film that I have ever seen. You need to be emotionally prepared to watch this film and the Alzheimer's disease reality that it presents. This is not a "date night" movie. Schindler's List has more lighthearted moments in it than The Father.Do not let these comments discourage you from watching The Father, though. If you are a fan of cinema and the wide breadth of emotions that it can elicit, The Father is simply a jaw-dropping exposition into the very raw emotions that this disease can, and has, inflicted on countless generations of families, including my own. You will probably not want to re-watch The Father as soon as it is finished, and that is okay. It reminds me of Requiem for a Dream (2000) in that both films are very emotionally powerful, but I was not dying to see either of them again right after I saw them the first time. Some films are better left to marinate on our consciousness, and The Father is certainly one of those.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I watched every movie nominated for each Oscar nominated actor & if somebody else wins not named Anthony Hopkins, then the Academy Awards should cease & desist. To play this role at that level is remarkable.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A gut punch of a movie about an elderly widower and his increasingly tenuous grip on reality. People come, people go--his former helper, his new helper, his daughter, his son-in-law--but we are never quite sure who is real and who is not, because some of them exist only in his imagination. It is precisely this confusion, on his part and ours, that is at the core of this heartbreaking film. As the title character, Anthony Hopkins is better than ever, losing little bits of himself (and large chunks of his memory) as he withers away before our eyes, turning in a performance that is as fully realized and richly detailed as any you will see this year. (If by the end of the film you still aren't weeping, you'd better have your tear ducts checked.) The splendid Olivia Colman is every bit as moving as his daughter, who desperately wants to do what's best for her dad but is not at all sure how to go about it. The lighting--generally subdued, and often downright dim--serves as a perfect metaphor for the darkness in his mind, and the long, long night that lies ahead. Flawlessly directed by Florian Zeller, who co-wrote the screenplay with Christopher Hampton. A Tony-winner in 2016 for Frank Langella, who starred in the stage version, also written by Zeller. Hopkins may be taking home a trophy or two of his own, and deservedly so.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It doesn't take more than 5 minutes to realize you will be watching a television theatre. Like that crap with Ewan McGregor I can't even remember the name of. This is exactly the same, pretentious, quasi-philosophical type of play. And a mundane, annoying one. One even sir Anthony would not save. As a matter of fact, this movie's only value hides in his participation. If you can even talk about value here. The rest is literally just a bland, ordinary story, the outcome of which you can easily guess. I mean, at first one may even think there will be some sort of mystery involved. Some sort of suspense. And to its credit, the first 15 minutes feel like there will be some mystery, some suspense. But then you realize there won't be anything like that and actually there won't be much at all. Just cheap thrills for the masses. Yes, you got that right. This movie is a cleverly disguised cheap thrill. And judging by the ratings, in that it actually succeeded.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My title says it. I watched his film for an hour until I said, enough. I wasn't going to be one who said I wasted the full 1:37. I had already wasted an hour and I quit. It was going nowhere and I had no anticipation that the other 37 minutes would be any better. I'd say if you go 30 minutes and don't get it, then you probably will not at all.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Really - unbelievable. Beautiful. Compelling. Within a few minutes I could already see why he won the Oscar (last night!). It does all become clear in the end, I think, although I might just watch it again to be sure. Olivia Colman is lovely, as always, so emotive... Really, a terrific film - just phenomenal, particularly because of Mr. Hopkins.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What an unsettling, horrifying, heartbreaking portrayal of the inside the mind of a person living with Alzheimer's. The desperation, helplessness, vulnerability, and unbearable confusion of living with Alzheimer's are portrayed perfectly in the movie. Such brilliant performances...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Sir Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman are sublime in "The Father," co-written and directed by Florian Zeller based on his Play. Oscar-winner Anthony Hopkins is simply masterful as an aging man suffering memory loss and Academy Award winner Olivia Colman ("The Favourite") is his daughter and caretaker Anne, equally skillful in her supporting role. The moments of quiet in this film, particularly at the end, are as powerful and significant to the story as the heart-wrenching, emotionally effective performances from the cast.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The kind of movie that you'll watch once and then forget about it.But ... an Oscar ??!!Anthony Hopkins one the best profurmnce award ??How ? Why ??

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Acting is top notch; you'd already guess by the actors. The problem is the story is not that interesting. The "trick" or gimmick is kinda new, but not worth the investment in time. I blame the trailer for misleading one to believe there was more intrigue in store. Story was obviously meant for a play; not a movie. Unless you get pleasure from a sharp stick in the eye, pass this one by.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The narrative is similar to Memento. We watch the story through the eyes of the main character (Anthony Hopkins plays divinely). Having an ailment, he can only improvise in situations where fate throws him. The director shows how important it is for people to be certain in their lives.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Between emotions and mind games, curiosity is evolved in our minds, many probabilities kept us thrilled till the end to know what is exactly going on there.It's a trip through dementia and obstinacy, clarifying the bad influences of them on the other people around you, who are concerned about and trying really hard to help you and put you into your comfort zone.The method of actions and post-actions that is applied by the great actor Anthony Hopkins (the father), and the genius Olivia Coleman (the daughter) to show the Emotions, the Obstacles, and the Disturbances that they are having between themselves and between each other, all of these themes are shown through repeated dialogues and repeated scenes.The movie represents how Anthony is lost in memories, and the what's the perfect explanation of dementia, the director - or maybe the writer - chose to show us the story through an image that contains themes of dementia and insanity, and this scenes of memories also show the struggle of Anne (Olivia Coleman) throughout her life wasting years attached to her father, afraid of leaving him alone, he was arrogant that he was not convinced that he is complaining and also a little bit selfish. Which brings us to the dilemma of love is sometimes devastating.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Amazing acting, Amazing writing.Some of us may well wind up the way he does one day.I pray to God I don't.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Holy smokes they are only in a flat and from start to finish was absolutely brilliant no doubt the acting was extremely good amd convincing. I recommend to anyone sit and watch this film and you will be impressed.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie is really something for a second there I really thought am I watching this movie or I'm the part of it.This is one of those movies where it plays mind games with you, confuse you, thrills you and finally shows you the harsh reality how it can be scary sometimes.Sir Anthony Hopkins did a great job, he's acting was just magnificent and he really deserved the oscar for it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Hopkins is brilliant as an aging father dealing with dementia and Colman a loving daughter faced with decisions concerning his eventual long term care.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Absolutely brilliant performance from both Academy Award winners - Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Coleman; two actors who never fail to deliver. A fascinating and emotional insight into what it is like for a person slowly descending into dementia, a cruel and vicious illness that steals little bits of a person on a daily basis until nothing is left.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I have nothing to add to the informative and interesting assessments of this great movie. Just for clinical interest....many reviewers mention Alzheimers, but my husband, who's a psychiatrist, felt Anthony's dementia was caused by Lewy Body Disease. It's very common, but not as well known by its name and is most often characterized by hallucinations and cognitive disonance, along with the memory loss it shares with Alzheimers.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: .. I lost my father the day before new years eve to demensia. Anthony Hopkins - you are a genius. You acted my father and his illness and you did it so well it broke my heart again.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Great to see sir hopkins in a new film. Always such a great actor. The movie was hard to watch because it hit home. Definitely a tough look at the horrible reality of dementia and everywhere affected by it. My grandmother is in the early stages and it breaks my heart.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
What a beautiful movie, good job Florian Zeller , you skillfully created all this fascinating drama and brought us into Anthony's world , the border between reality and dream , what a good script , what a beautiful decoupage and what mezzanines Simple but at the same time special , the soundtrack captures the human heart and doubles the dramatic burden of the film.
But Anthony Hopkins , this inexhaustible man in the world of cinema to whom you owe an Oscar , all my respect to you anthony hopkins , Olivia Coleman, you are a full-fledged actress.
This movie should be seen many times and enjoy every moment of it .

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What a wonderful, amazing, humane way to tell a story.As a viewer I was immersed and felt every bit of the characters sense of reality.Simply wonderful the way it's told.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Many films have depicted this disease, but few have dared to do it from the perspective of the person who suffers from it. It is appreciated that the scriptwriter is a pioneer in this regard. In addition, creative decisions are correct regarding the message. The best thing about the movie is Anthony Hopkins, who deserves much more than an Oscar for this performance. The only flaw is that, on very few occasions, the tape feels tedious and perhaps it could have been even shorter. If not for that (like one or two scenes), I would give it 10/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Mr Hopkins will get his award for sure after such a good acting. Second of all, the visual production was amazing! First half hour of the movie I have found myself at struggling to figure out the design of the house; the objects were constantly changing as well as the places of rooms (even it did not, they succeed to deceive me right there) and I completely felt the same as Anthony. It gives you a chance to identify with the main character, so that was really good attempt and a directorial success.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie gives us a message that we never abandon our elder ones. I literally cried at the ending.And acting is totally lit. Great work.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Wow! This film blew my mind. Having just dealt with the death of my dementia-ridden elderly mother, this story cut a bit too close to my own experience. While Alzheimer's is a horror story for the victim, this film shows us that the family and caregivers need sympathy, too. So true! Anthony Hopkins is brilliant as is Olivia Coleman. First-rate performances and fine filmmaking. A must see. Bring a box of Kleenex. Hope for a cure for this terrible brain-wasting disease.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm at a loss for words, I just can't describe the mix of emotions I felt watching this movie. The editing of the film is wonderful, in the beginning everything seems very confusing, in fact, until the end of the film many of the things are still confused. However, I believe that this is what the film wants to go through when we watch it, this is how it goes in the head of a person with Alzheimer's, this is really how he feels ... Confused, confused with everything, confused with his feelings and confused why people don't understand what happens to them.It is certainly one of the best films I have ever seen in my life, it is about a daughter's true love towards her father, it is about the obstacles that she has to face in relation to her illness and the extent to which she could take it this ... After all, we are all human, nobody is made of iron and to what extent can we endure situations like these by someone we love?I really hope this movie wins some Oscars, I will advise everyone!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I had such a mix of emotion watching this movie. In parts it's strange and almost horror movie like. Other parts are very emotional. The fantastic acting of Anthony Hopkins makes the portrayal of a elderly man suffering with mental illness so very real.I'd recommend this movie to everyone.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anyone who a aw me watch this just saw a 40year old white male cry his eyes out. Incredible performance by Anthony Hopkins on a subject many don't understand or choose to ignore. The end scene almost killed me.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Except I don't appreciate the music being too heavy, it definitely worths your watching. You'll have the idea of what dementia is and how you probably should do to deal with it or to face it yourself.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
"I feel as if I'm losing my all leaves"some movies are really hard to describe,
some movies never actually feels like a movie,
some movies keep haunting us all the time,
this is that movieThe Father is a breathtaking work of art. Have come across a lots of work on memory loss, dementia etc, but it's not like any of them. It's like a dream, a confusing one, we often see; a constant fight with reality. A remarkable style of story telling, mind-blowing direction, Sir Anthony Hopkins' genius, unforgettable scenes and top notch editing - this uncanny thing is the finest of movies I ever watched. Can't say more!Have seen Minari & Nomadland, and personally I think The Father deserves Oscar more than anyone. Have no doubt on Hopkins' 2nd Academy this year. Hope it will get all the 6! Yes..

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Trigger warning for anyone who cant handle seeing old men break down.. like me. I really needed that warning. Sobbing, this really broke me. Dementia through the lens of the sufferer. This movie nailed what it must feel like on both ends of the spectrum. Anyway I'm going to call my dad now.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anne (Olivia Colman) attempts to care for her aging father (Anthony Hopkins) that refuses to accept his need for assistance. Florian Zeller wrote the stage play, wrote the adapted screenplay (with help from Christopher Hampton), and directed the film. (Sheesh!)Immediately after watching all 8 2021 Best Picture nominees, I ranked The Father #6 out of 8. After watching for the second time, I think it probably should've been upped to 4 or 5. Even though I still think there were better films in the mix, I have yet to get over how PHENOMENAL this film's screenplay, performances, and general production were.Other than Best Picture, The Father was nominated for five other awards at this year's Oscars: Best Actor (Anthony Hopkins), Best Supporting Actress (Olivia Colman), Film Editing, Production Design, and Best Adapted Screenplay. Per usual, I completely agree with all of these nominations, but I would've liked to see Cinematography in there as well. The cinematography was simple yet so well executed. There were many times where the camera stayed in one place as the characters moved around it, and it was notably impressive.Without a doubt, the two best aspects of the film were the screenplay and Mr. Anthony Hopkins (which aligns with the Oscar wins). The screenplay is original and a brilliant way to tell the story of dementia. Hopkins' performance in this film should be studied in acting school. He flips the switch from comfortable to scared at the drop of a hat, and he does it seamlessly. His expressions, body language, and tone are perfect for the role, and his Oscar is very well deserved.The search is still on for a film adapted from a play where we don't feel stuck in one location. Thankfully, the flat we were bound to in The Father was absolutely beautiful. It was charming and warm and the Opera music we heard so often added to that warmth aptly. Despite the lack of diversity, I ended up enjoying the production design quite a bit.Now, even after all of those wonderful accolades (and minor criticisms), I still wouldn't say that I was thoroughly entertained for the entire run-time. Many aspects wowed me, yet I still found myself to be a little bored. I was happy that the run-time was a short hour and 37 minutes because it felt repetitive once I understood what was happening. There didn't seem to be a real climax, although I did think the ending was pretty remarkable. I needed a bit more ebb and flow to keep me interested.Out of all the movies nominated for Oscars this year, this is definitely one you need to see. Watch to see a master of acting, a remarkable screenplay, and dementia through a different lens.@boomroastedmoviecritic on Instagram.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This was extremely well acted and was very moving, but I felt it jumped around too much I know its supposed to show the confusion but it felt a little too rushed and unexplained.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If you never experienced dementia in family, then you'll probably find this movie kinda.. boring. Watching repeatable simple dialogs and scenes isn't really entertaining. Some will maybe be touched at the end of the movie.. either because they're sensitive or simply because that is "expected" when watching such movie.My father had dementia and all I can say is, this movie is the closest I've ever seen. I say closest, because movie mostly shows demented person's view and behavior and doesn't touch much other's family members feelings and thoughts (in this case, daughter and her husband). I think that was made on purpose, so observer can concentrate more on main character -so observer can understand him better (as far that's even possible).In that sense, this is an one actor movie. And what an act it is! Hopkins's execution in brilliant... real... he IS demented -and I know what I am talking about.No, I won't watch this movie ever again.. too many memories become alive.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: 82/100The Father is a truly mesmerizing, seamless and devastating placement into the perspective of an aging and mentally ill man. all of the twists and turns faced by Anthony in the film are just as daunting and confusing for the viewer as they are for him in the film, and it makes this film a brutal but addicting watch. The movie is a seemingly endless episode of The Twilight Zone and i could have been captivated by it for at least another 30 minutes of added runtime. Hopkins and Colman both deliver master class and award-worthy performances as one would expect, just adding on to the greatness of the film

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Best movie of 2021. Anthony Hopkins was truly amazing. If he doesn't get best actor it will be a travesty.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Exquisite, unique, so painfully that I started to cry... Full of emotions and feelings... Anthony Hopkins must win this academy award. Bravo! 👏 👏 👏

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is Anthony Hopkins best film to date , his performance his peerless. This told entirely from his perspective and understanding. It is bewildering and tragic. I loved this film but it is sad and pulls no punches in regards to growing old with dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father was a well-done movie. There were many things that I have liked about it. First of all, Anthony Hopkin's acting was incredible. He excellently represented the inner conflicts and emotions of his character that the audience also felt. He is one of the best names in acting even when he is old. Secondly, storytelling was incredible. This kind of storytelling is something that many of us have never experienced before. Even though it got really confusing, it felt really realistic in a way that you think you are actually suffering from it. With the combination of storytelling and acting, you can easily get into the story. Finally, the length of the movie was just okay. I think it would get really out of hand if the movie was about 2.30 hours long.However, I didn't like the complexity that the movie tries to create very much. I know it is the point of it, but it starts to make everything harder for the audience, in my opinion. I believe it is not a good idea to reveal the truth after creating so much confusion. I think this way because, after a moment, you can't remember every detail about the previous scenes, and it becomes hard for you to make connections and realize the reality in the movie. I know that the last scene of the film was powerful. But it still annoyed me a bit and dropped my pleasure of watching because I couldn't grasp what was actually going on. Maybe, that is the point.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: We see the importance of the edition here because it's really another character in the movie. However, over everything, the end broke my mind, because to think about the role interpreted by Anthony Hopkins on How he wakes up every morning thinking that he is at home with his daughter, that who doesn't love as much as the other one who died by an accident, he wakes up confused and with an attitude similar like a child one... It's very scary to think about getting older in this way, so raw and real.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The story is to portray about the old and Alzheimer dad, but it's so tender, sentimental and real honestly. It can't deny that the leading actor is a legend and totally agree with why he got an Oscar award. Beside, the way of telling story makes me feel touch, sad, and laugh sometimes. It's hard to tell people what Alzheimer people think, but this movie can show visually these concerns. Honestly, the relationship between my dad and I isn't smooth and rich, however, I need to think again about this relationship after done this movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: There is no doubt that Alzheimer's is one of the most difficult diseases and conditions that a person goes through in the last stages of his life. We hear about it and read it continuously, but this is the first time we touch this sad experience and live it as if it were a personal experience during our viewing of this masterpiece "The Father"Directing is unparalleled, as it's made the viewers as if they were a member of this elderly man's family, they were literally able to reverse what is going on in the patient's mind from random memories, loss and fear to a moving picture, and he was able to connect the unconnected and intertwined events in his mind by a smooth and coherent manner at the same time this is exactly what Alzheimer's means.When the big-screen giant Anthony Hopkins is in the work, we can't just close our eyes for a second. His acting level isn't reached by an actor before, every detail, every behavior and involuntary and involuntary reaction that the elderly perform in the role without even noticing that he is acting, but rather actually doing it even intuitively.Of course, there was some incomprehensible scenes and put us in a questionable position, for which we will not find an answer, but this is exactly the point of those scenes.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: One of the greatest actor of all time in his best performance. This will remains with you forever.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Not much to say, it's beautifully done, it's truly profound and inspired and Hopkins gives the performance of his career. This film is a must-see, once-in-a-lifetime piece that accurately depicts dementia, and ends on one of the most heartbreaking scenes in all of cinema. Please watch this movie, it deserves every second of your time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony is an intelligent man in his early 80s, who is slowly descending into the twilight world of dementia. We see events from his perspective, which means a Kafkaesque, nightmarish world in which people switch identity, and even his own flat alters its appearance. The only downside of this approach is that we are never sure whether the conversations he experiences have ever happened, or may be memories of past events, or with other people. Anthony Hopkins is an excellent actor, who conveys the part with great depth and conviction. Don't expect a happy ending, though.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My grandmother has an alzheimer's disease. When i take her photo and show her she says who's this old lady? When she realise that this is her she is starting cry I think this is the one of most killing illness cause when you don't remember anything what's the point of your life?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: First off - it's the best acted film I've ever seen. Across the board. Just sensational. And yes, it's Hopkins' greatest ever screen performance by some distance - and with his stellar body of work - that's some statement, and subsequently some performance. Holy Cow. Delighted for him and his win, the most deserving of my lifetime I think.Beyond the acting, though - we have one of the most powerful and important films ever made. It's the best debut I've ever seen. It's the saddest film I've ever seen, but I've seen it 3 times. I can't stop thinking about it.As with every awards season, I check out all the major contenders. This should have won everything. Nothing was better, and it was a pretty bloody strong year.For me? This could be the best film of the century so far.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If you have hoped to find a movie that makes you feel like you are trapped in a terrible nightmare, hoping, praying and inexplicably waiting for some sort of twist... look no further because this is that movie.With all the talent in this movie, I really wanted to love it, sadly I am mad at myself for not turning it off because I can never unsee this abomination.Surely the sheep will droll on about how real and deep this is but rest assured it's only "real" and "deep" in the sense that you will really want to jump in the deep end of a hard drink after watching this never ending horror film.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Whole movie except final scene told me that there is something fishy like a conspiracy over Anthony's flat.Movie has some Alzheimer's desease but if it is about psycho desease then it should had other additional psycho illnesses. Not only Anthony, all other roles and writer, directors are mad and lunatic.Edit: I am just saying that only 10 or 20 percent scenes of this movie truly show how Alzheimer works. Other parts seems dreams with hallucinations, schizophrenia possibly some other mental illness that I can not name.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: 83 year old Anthony Hopkins portrays the father role who have a skewed and delusional memory due to the demantia adapted by the play *La Pere* to the cinema. Considering his age, his performance was spectacular and made me cry a few times while i was watching it. One of his finest acting along with The Elephant man and Remains of the Day. The Grade for Sir Anthony Hopkins acting and musical score of the film for Ludovico Einaudi are 9 but the film does not deserve more than 8.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Being a Hopkins fan, I was looking forward to seeing his latest film, playing an old man entering the final chapter of his life.The film is brilliantly played by Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman, but was far too violent to my heart for me to say I enjoyed it.Having fairly recently gone through a very similar experience with my own father just a few years ago, the film brought back, with shining clarity, all of the horrible memories of his final months.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's safe to say that Sir Anthony Hopkins is a national treasure and he is just breathtaking in this role.My god, what a performance!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The wasted hour and a half (the film's short duration is its only plus) gives me the right to say, don't watch this crap. There is no drama, no plot, no nothing. The movie is empty. Sick ramblings of an old man.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Wonderfully shot and acted. Thoughtful approach to dementia and insights into how muddled the mind can become, messing with time. This will do more for your long-term care planning than anything else.8/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony and Olivia deliver a deeply powerful and utterly heart-wrenching perspective of life with dementia. Anthony has such a way to switch emotion on a pin drop with such immovable force that to watch till the end had me holding back the tears.Such a subject could not be handled nor portrayed by any greater cast and crew with such accuracy in editing nor better symphony of acting.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The performance of Hopkins is superb! I hope he wins an Oscar for this. This is a very touching film and what I liked about it is that we see dementia from a different perspective (the perspective of the person who suffers from it). Bravo!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Brilliantly crafted story, have never seen anything quite like it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This will stay with me for a long time. My mum had dementia and Anthony Hopkins absolutely got it. May be his strongest performance ever. Totally mesmerising.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: One of the greatest movies and acting I've ever seen...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What a beautiful movie about a condition often forgotten. After working as an at home nurse, you often see people struggle with Alzheimers, where they sometimes remember you, and other times they don't. It is a scary condition explained perfectly in this movie, and how it effects yourself and others around you. Should be a must see for everyone.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A gripping movie and sad movie that brings you on an emotional rollercoaster. Anthony Hopkins steals the show, an absolutely fantastic performance.I have to say I was a little disappointed with the ending. I get why they did it, but still thought it could have ended differently.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins delivers the greatest performance I have ever seen on film. So much for actors being at the height of their powers when young. Olivia Coleman is also very good as his daughter. The filming and the way the set decorations changed helped me to feel how he felt losing his mind. This is what movies are for. I highly recommend.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This isn't just a film about dementia, it's an journey and what a ride!This film deliberately leaves the audience a bit lost and confused throughout as we're not just watching we're a part Antony's word as he sees it.It's a tough call but I think this is the best I have ever seen Sir Anthony Hopkins in. One of the most deserved Oscars.I was a mess by the end."I feel as if I'm losing all my leaves". I broke right there.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Good: Firstly, the actors. Of course, Anthony Hopkins shows us a master class in acting - but that wouldn't be enough if everyone around him faltered. Thankfully, they don't - with the entire (small) cast performing astonishingly well with gripping, believable and nuanced performances. The directing is also tight and assured (in a directorial debut no less) - in keeping the setting small, the first-time director can play to his strengths - using the same amount of space he would have in a stage play. Using the unreliable narrator trope is also a clever move - as it keeps the story engaging and interesting when there's actually not much going on in the 'timeline'.The Bad: There isn't much to complain about really. It's a small script that doesn't really go anywhere outside the main characters - this is not a criticism, but don't expect a grand tale with sweeping cinematic gestures - this is firmly about a father, daughter and those in close proximity.Should you watch it: This is an intense film with a gripping final scene. If you are OK with the subject matter (my mum can't watch this as my grandfather went through this), then the film will leave you with a lasting impression. Highly recommended.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A perspective of the world from a man with dementia. This is an absolute masterpiece. So powerful, so sad I will never watch this movie again.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: One of the best acting of Anthoni Hopkins, if he at the end of this month get an Oscar, he will deserve it, the movie generally has nice story and editing is so great,

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I appreciate that Anthony Hopkins is a skilled actor and so forth, but I gave the movie The Father a 1/10, a fat ONE. - I am not a member of the 1% who needs a movie to experience how depressed life can be. For me movies are an escape pod to a few joyful, entertaining moments. I don't understand why movies are made to depress us. Who are the people that actually like to watch how old people embarrass themselves? This is so extremely sad. Go for love and enjoy life. - Well, okay a 3/10 because it wasn't ALL bad.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anyone with elderly parents, regardless of their mental state, will instantly recognize and empathize with many of the characters. It's the main reason the story is so compelling.The second reason is the magnificent performances by all the actors especially Olivia Coleman who shows the full gamut of emotions she goes through in an understated way. In the age of overacting, this was refreshing indeed.We all know about Anthony Hopkins so I will say no more but he becomes everyone's elderly father the the duration of the movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It is a Big movie, that show us how people with dementia are living day by day. Their life isn't easy, but it's harder to live with relative, who has dementia, - watching every day, how your lovely person can not remember easiest things. But the hardest it's to do the right thing, which wiIl be the best for everyone. I think all this important things were showed perfectly on screen. Also, I'm not sure that there exist the better actor than Anthony Hopkins, who could play this role. Bravo for director and for actors! Bravo!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: And that's how you make a film. Great acting by Sir Anthony Hopkins and no wonder he got an Oscar for his fabulous performance as Anthony, rest of the cast, moved along with the flow. What a fantabulous film.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Great acting and engaging story but an absolutely class-based depiction of dementia as a challenge for individuals, families and health systems. This is a highly sanitised upper class private health care view of dementia care. Having lived through my grandfather and father-in-law dying of dementia and working as a GP in Australia in a disadvantaged community I can tell you the choices and options facing most families are much more acute and problematic than this. This is a well acted sanitised upper class view of dementia as a community anc health system problem.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Absolutely Hopkins masterclass. This movie is brilliant in every sense of the word. And an amazing insight into the world of dementia. Very well done. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
The father is one of the best movies of 2020
I was lucky to see it during Cairo international film festival inside Cairo opera house
The movie have 2 important points
Firstly of course the great performance specially bu sir Anthony Hopkins and I think he has a good chance to win his second Oscar
Secondly the way of narrative was great as we watch the movie by the eye of old man with divagation , we don't know what we see is real or not , this help us to understand the the idea of the movie
If we talk about oscars I think this movie deserves nominations in : the leading actor, adaptation screenplay, best picture, supporting actress for Olivia Colman

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Zellman's 'The Father' is a lot more than a film that merely exists to tell you a story. This is an experience and a journey into an unstable world that is just as real, as it is make-believe.At once stupendously effective and profoundly upsetting, "The Father" might be the first movie about dementia to give me actual chills.Combining mystery and psychodrama, "The Father" is a majestic depiction of things falling away: People, surroundings and time itself are becoming ever more slippery.It's a brutal, terrifyingly simple technique, backed by a production design that manipulates the details of his surroundings just enough to make us question where - and when - we are.Father belongs to the veteran actor Anthony Hopkins who won Oscars for the Best Actor for The Fatherand the debutant director who has moved beyond cliche and sentimentality to reveal the true nature of dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: When her time comes, shall his grandchildren put her in the same institution and even in the SAME ROOM of his. Quoting the movie: "It'd be better for HER". And finally, suggesting an idea for a Part 2 of the movie: he ultimately dies and reincarnates as her nurse...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's actually the first time that I see a realistic point of view of a person with dementia and amnesia. It makes me think how difficult it is. These guys did a really great job showing it to us. This is really a great, great movie. And Anthony Hopkins of course... well... you know...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I will never watch this movie ever again, ever.But everyone should atleast try and watch it once.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film does an amazing job of giving an insight into the confusing world that a dementia sufferer inhabits. Memories of people, events and places lost or distorted and sometimes imagined; faces and names changing, time shifting.Hopkins plays Anthony, a man struggling to make sense of what is happening to him. Visited by Anne (his daughter) who is trying to care for her father while holding her life together the story centres around their exchanges, difficult, scary, sometimes humourous, and for the greater part bewildering, we are given Anthony's version of reality to decipher.What the film does so well is to bring some of that disorientation to the viewer, without becoming inaccessible. Hopkins does an astonishing job - but credit has to go to everyone involved, the entire cast, the direction, the writing, the music, and everything in-between.The film's stage roots are evident in the simplicity of its location, set almost entirely in an apartment, and this is crucial in creating a feeling of claustrophobic, but also in letting us experience the life of the characters.Never slipping into sentimentality, we are nevertheless taken on a bruising emotional journey, never 100% sure of what is real (which of course is the point) somehow I left the cinema feeling that I understood a whole lot more about the reality, and surrealities of life for a sufferer, which is an incredible achievement.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I was getting confused and bored before I realised that was a small part of the necessary experience and at that realisation was drawn into the journey of dementia and the revelation of the importance of a simple watch. (You'll understand when you hear 'Anthony' explain in a throw away line of great importance.Anthony Hopkins' performance is incredible as he draws you into a distorted but honest reality.Not for the feint hearted or those without compassion but a must see for those seeking to understand dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
You know a feeling of when you are sucking and wandering, and your brain flips a map while you are lost in it
A time when you feel a feeling of fear and anxiety, a feeling that gives your body a shudder, a feeling of your own joy.A film that is classified under I am not a movie, I am life
Your age is until he walks through you to reach the place of nowhere by reaching the starting point like a circle you are in its surroundings
I mean, there is no feeling or words that describe the cinematic masterpiece that I saw from a little bit, and from this moment we agree with the Oscar.Literally an hour and 36 minutes, let me forget that I am sitting in front of a screen.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Incredible acting, I just felt everything he felt. Literally, it is a performance that should win an Oscar. The script is very remarkable that takes your attention at the very beginning and holds it untill the very end. And in the end, he left me in tears. We missed you Sir Hopkins.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Having lost my mother after a long illness, and her father before her to Alzheimer's, I knew this movie would be emotional for me. Even though he has been my all-time favorite actor, Sir Anthony Hopkins surprised me. I cried twice during the film. If ever there was an Oscar-worthy performance, this was it. I'll never forget it as long as I live. Unless, perhaps, I get dementia someday. I've worried about that ever since my grandfather died. 10/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: You'll get to see such amazing performances only once in a while the story direction everything was so good do watch it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I understand Anthony Hopkins is in the movie, but how does that automatically make it a 10? Yes, his performance was fantastic, yes, the supporting characters also did very well. In my opinion, there wasn't any climax to the movie, not really a whole ton of excitement, just a very steady rhythm of confusion (intended) and uncertainty. Yes I get it, there's meant to be confusion because it's really supposed to emphasize how an individual with dementia and/or Alzheimer's would feel. I think they did an excellent job highlighting the fear that comes with this type of condition, and the family challenges that may develop. I'd consider it more of an educational movie with plain avenues of entertainment versus a jaw-dropping, box office breaking film. I'll more than likely get a lot of criticism for this, but everyone's entitled to their opinion.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
It's an Prospective View
More Relatable sometimes
It's messed up.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I saw this at the Woodstock film festival and it stayed with me long after. The conceit of experiencing dementia and confusion through the eyes of the person suffering from it it very effective, and coupled with great performances, this is a great little piece of cinema.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I have worked for years with talking care of the old. Only a year with dementia and this movie is the most real depiction I have ever seen. Incredibly powerful, we still cant understand whats going on for real in a brain plagued by this illness, but this is as close as we can get, I really do believe so. Anthony Hopkins will win best actor and best picture, without a doubt, what a masterful performance, wow.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Holy s**t! Everything and everyone was superb, but Anthony Hopkins' acting was... mind-blowing is an understatement!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I can't believe how mind blowing and brain exhausting this movie is, such case was brought by the magnificent performance of the great Anthony Hopkins.This movie enlighten a well known problem but with a very different and intelligent approach, how could the patient feel? How burning is his mind and soul when there is no reality or you can't perceive it?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I just finished watching the film and I am speechless. Acting, writing and directing are all absolutely brilliant. This picture is a breath of fresh air in the polluted world of today's cinema.Sir Anthony Hopkins gives one of the finest performances ever put on film. My grandfather had dementia and seeing this film brought back the memories so vividly that it almost made me want to stop watching. The gestures, the sudden mood swings and the slow fall into the horrible word that is dementia are all perfectly portrayed by Mr. Hopkins.Olivia Colman also delivers a powerhouse of a performance in this film. The role is not an easy one, playing the daughter of a man affected by Alzheimer's, but she shines through the whole film and honestly deserves as much praise as Hopkins.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Most movies are 3rd person watching all of the characters as things happen. This movie is 1st person through the eyes of the person suffering mental decline. We were confused at first and then realized that is the intent.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is one of those movies that will keep you thinking for a long time. The performance which Anthony Hopkins provided us is a brilliant but scary look at what many of us may have to look forward to as we age.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Confusing flick. Perhaps it was intended that way. While the ensemble cast acted this flick wonderfully, the subject of dementia as portrayed by Anthony Hopkins was frightening and confusing.If the intention was to confuse the audience, then it gets a solid 9. But the subject matter and the way it was presented was pretty jarring.Suggest that "millennials" watch this to see what's in store for them in later life.I found the film tedious and confusing.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: After watching this movie I really have a great understanding not only with dementia but with old age. How can you keep up with the present if your reality keeps messing up in a matter of minutes with different details? 😢 This is very heartbreaking to watch and you'll be left there with all of the emotions of someone who has this illness. 😢 I just love how amazing Anthony Hopkins portray Anthony here. He's really a great actor. So awesome performance.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm just really blown away by Anthony Hopkins's performance. Tender, moving, and heartbreaking look at dementia from the point of view of the person suffering from it. If this movie does not bring tears to your eyes, your heart is made of stone.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The whole film is a masterpiece. But without giving anything away, the last ten minutes of this incredible film, is the best single piece of acting I have ever seen. As a man suffering desperately from dementia, Anthony Hopkins gives a mesmerising performance.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: As a viewer, you become emotionally attached to Anthony Hopkins character and feel at one with him. You feel what it's like for people with Dementia and on their life coming to a slow end. Absolutely brilliantly portrayed.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Both of the actor's acting was incredible!! I loved watching this. They treated the subject of the movie very softly that it made this movie so easy to watch even though the whole topic is sad and heart breaking. I loved the scenario and cinematography. And i also loved seeing Sir Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman together. Superb acting and a quality movie!! Must watch.By the way, during the movie i cried several times but when the movie was over, i got out of the mall and went to the car and cried my eyes out like i could not even believe that was just yesterday. I remembered every single pain i've been through since i've lost my grandparents 3 years in a row. I felt connected to that money. Definitely will watch later again to witness this beautiful acting for one more time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: First of all, Anthony Hopkins gives one of his best performances as a man struggling with dementia, only topped by his role in Silence of the Lambs.Secondly, The Father shows how powerful storytelling can be. It shows incredibly well what it is like for a person with dementia to realise his slowly loosing his mind and there is nothing to be done about it.It isn't confusing or complex. It is just storytelling at its best and a short set of actores giving some of the best performances of their carrers.One of the best movies of the year.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Having just watched this knowing as little as possible about it, other than it was based on a play about a dementia sufferer and Hopkins won an Oscar, I expected the usual drama on how difficult the patients are to manage & the pain the family go through.What I did not expect was the brilliant playwrighting, the set pieces that fantastically illustrate the sinister tricks decaying memory plays on the afflicted, the way the film drops you almost into the mind of the man via those illustrations and of course the overall well above average acting; helmed by Hopkins himself in probably the best acting he has done in his entire career.I'm trying to emphasise just how brilliantly crafted the whole thing is without giving any spoilers and you really should go in to it with a similar mindset outlined in the first paragraph of this review.This goes straight to the top of my "plays turned into movies" top 3 - followed by Glengarry Glen Ross and The Sunset Limited.Ironically, this film about dementia or Alzheimer's will stay with you forever.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Well, a well made film on mental illness but- hard to watch. Informative yes, entertaining, no. Good for students maybe or professionals, or some type of medical training. Not a good film to watch on a saturday night with your girlfriend.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Great directing, superb acting particularly by Anthony Hopkins. Dealing with a hard subject sympatheticly. Not a light view but it will leave you emotional.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If you do or if you don't know anyone who has had dementia this film will leave you chilled to the bone. I have always been a HUGE Hopkins fan and this is why.This film will make you think twice before you put off that phone call you should of made or that visit you didn't make to someone who needs you.We can all hope and pray that our minds don't go like in this film.An absolute film to watch...!!!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Simple story, well played, no better way to describe Alzheimer's ......

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Sir Anthony Hopkins is quite literally the best actor I have ever seen. His performance is so startlingly honest and impeccable that the mere recollection of the final scene possesses the power to immediately illicit tears and render me a heaving pulp. It is witnessing a triumvirate; the excellently-written character, the finest of actors bringing the page to life ultimately culminating in a truth so powerful that simultaneously shows both the fragile human mind and the indomitable human spirit.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A very sad, very realistic, touching story that gives you a look to a troubled aging mind. If you ever had a person with dimentia in your family this film is definitely gonna touch you and stick with you. Anthony Hopkins is amazing and there is no way you don't feel sympathetic to his character. At the end of the film you just want to give the old boy a hug. Since we can't give him a hug, please give him the oscar.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's undeniably stagy but that doesn't bother at all. The fantastic script, adapted from the play, combined with the outstanding editing are only surpassed by a superb cast, lead by Anthony Hopkins who delivers a mindblowing performance.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Movie portrays the cruelty of dementia in vivid colors and Hopkins delivers big time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Easy to say this is Hopkins' best performance.It is so easy for him to be natural yet delivers heart wrenching performance.How did u react when he was slapped by that man??I was mad like hell. Like someone slapped my own parent. That how great his performance was. This movie will haunt you for years.Great movie. Great movie indeed.

Title: THE FATHER

What a performance..
Great movie with a hard-to-forget kind of message.The actors did a great job but Hopkins really steals the show once again.One of the best films in recent years, trully remarkable work.

Title: THE FATHER
