Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The movie gives the audience a view of reality from the perspective of a man suffering from dementia. A beautiful movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is a realistic portrayal of dementia and the hardships that come with it for the person afflicted and family.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: So we have tons of movies that show us how is the live of a family member or nurse that take care of people with dementia, I don't recall a movie that portraits the person himself with the disease.Worst than a horror movie, you imagine yourself in that prison and abyss of which you can't just run or get out by yourself, either you have someone that has the courage to help you or you are in it forever..My grandma had dementia and was somewhat like this, my mother has Alzheimer and seems softer than the dementia, but still o can see she is not there anymore and we can't do nothing, they are there to stay and go into the void day by day.What a cruel end of live this is, and the movie showed me a side I haver never thought of, or I chose not to think on... this movie stays with you, specially if you have someone in your family but also stays with you if maybe one day we can suffer of this what then?Brilliant acting of Lord Anthony Hopkins (he actually uses his own name), the cry he does in the last scenes makes me feel like I have a baby in front of me and it is exactly what they are defenseless babies.Watch it if you are ok to look into the abyss of you are to sensitive don't watch it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film is a masterpiece. Acting, cinematography, direction, production, story... All first class.An absolute, full-blown, outstanding, wonderful, haunting, beautiful, devastating, mind-bending masterpiece.Congratulations to all involved.Highly recommended.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie is straight up A Masterpiece. Anthony Hopkins acting is phenomenal. A sad, confusing, horrifying And a Well made, well directed movie. Every supporting actor/actresses were too good. I pray for those elderly who have dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Well done to all. Antony Hopkins never fails to deliver. He shows dementia from the side of the sufferer. At times it's almost like a psychological thriller.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie is absolutely amazing! Scary, sad, funny, surprising, daunting, name it whatever because it is everything and nothing at the same time. A true depiction of whats like to have dementia. A scary world where time does not move forward, nor backwards. A natural pathway of all of us, the dissolution of our cognition to levels of hallucinations where we just want mummy to protect us from the wilderness of reality to finally going back being the trees connected to the air, to gravity and the cosmos.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony hopkins is marvelous. I don't know if I'll be able to understand this at 80+ but I sure do know that this is the closest reality I've seen. It is so meaningful that you can understand it only if you've experienced it, definitely not as our protagonist😂

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is brilliant (as he is in 99% of the movies in which he stars). The movie - a bit convoluted in that one might question whether we are looking at the scenes through the eyes and mind of "Anthony" (the character) or through the lens of the camera.........or a bit of both angles but overall a moving, heart wrenching portrayal by not only Anthony Hopkins but Olivia Colman (who plays the part of his loving and distressed daughter), Anne. A movie probably not for everyone or all ages but for mature audiences (who DON'T NEED to hear an F-word every 5 minutes or view explicit sex scenes that serve no point or purpose).

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is another amazing performance from both Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman. It takes place largely in a single apartment with a minimal cast. The film is about a father who is starting to go crazy. We as an audience are witnessing this through Anthony's eyes so you aren't quite sure what is going on. You can personally feel the confusion that he feels. It all comes together in a sad but satisfying ending. Really good watch!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I had to watch this movie mostly, to be able to decide on my own, if the Academy made some sort of terrible mistake by giving the Oscar to, Sir Hopkins. After watching Chad's performance I thought, how could this possibly be!?. But, this a much better vehicle then what Chad had. To see this decease turn this man inside out was both, painful and riveting. I don't know if he was better, but he was definitely as good as he can possibly be. I'm reminded of Schindler's List. I'm referring to the gut wrenching pain the film makes you go through while watching it. It definitely made that kind of impression that, stays with you for longer than I'd care to carry it. I always knew this decease was atrocious but, experiencing it from the affected individual really sheds a blinding light on it. And to me those are the movies that deserve all and, more of the attention it so rightfully deserves.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
I had the wonderful opportunity to see The Father at CIFF this year. I went in excited to see what Sir Anthony Hopkins would do with a study on dementia. As I consider Sir Anthony as arguable the best actor in film these days I had pretty high expectations. And I was not at all let down. When his character, also named Anthony, become confused or curmudgeonly you recognize some of his other great performances. But in fact I was most impressed at how warm and charming of a character Sir Anthony could also play. He was just simply spell binding when his character was his "old self". With all this being said perhaps the most remarkable performance of the film comes from Olivia Colman who plays Anthony's daughter, Anne. The patience, frustration, hurt and unwavering love depicted while Anne tries to find the best way to care for her father is truly remarkable. I'm sure there will be Oscar buzz for both of these performances and for the adapted screen play of Director Florian Zeller.
Now a little SPOILER to help people better enjoy this film. The Father in a way is shot like a mystery. Time lines are repeated , characters change in the story all while the audience sits confused. You do by the end understand that this is done to represent the progression of Anthony's disease. And you as an audience get to experience the strangeness of a mind that is being let down by itself. This is presented as a kind of plot twist. But I think the film will be more enjoyable for most if you understand in advance what is going on.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Since I was the trailer
I was convinced that film was targeting awards .The story hunts down your interest and keep it .You want to know if he in a parallel dimension or if he was tricked or ill.Despite the story lines the film was direct, and was not tricking you due to the nature of the topic.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If you have old parents, you will feel identified. I understand why he won the oscar.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's a good movie. The film is shot in one location and the storyline is a bit slow, however it is not boring at all. I was just confused about the story.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Possibly the most heart wrenching movie I've ever seen. My mother had 5 strokes and became senile, confused and forgetful. Anthony Hopkins performance was spellbinding and the way it was shot from his perspective brought back vivid memories for me and also an understanding of why people with it behave the way they do.It's one you have to watch and not half watch whilst doing other things, but it's worth it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Might be the best movie of 2020.The way dementia is portrayed and puts you in the shoes of the person suffering from it, lifted by a memorable soundtrack and immersive performances - it really shows how powerful of a medium films can be. My feelings echo what others are saying about Anthony Hopkins' performance, and how he overshadowed everyone else. The writing and direction is no joke - making the audience connect emotionally with a confused character to a level where you feel like you're the one suffering when he does - is a feat in itself.I highly recommend it, because it brings in a sense of sympathy and patience in high doses for the people suffering from dementia, something the people who made this movie were aiming for.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Sometimes, movies speak to us in a powerful way. They're personal accounts, intense stories that at some point may touch our lives in ways that we never anticipated.Regardless, "The Father" is much more. It's an account of all those alive. Those that have, and those that haven't looked at dementia deep down in its eyes.I agree that this movie is so good that I never want to watch it again. It's moving, it's powerful, and it's absolute magic delivered by all of those involved - from scriptwriter, to actors, director, down to editing.Thank you. Thank you. There aren't that many stories crafted in such a way that we're certain they'll never leave our hearts.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Watching The Father I kept feeling a sense of confusion while questioning what I was missing and where I was in the day. I realised by the end, this film had given me a sense of what it was like to be this incredible character The Father. Beautifully crafted.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Stunning, beautiful portrayal of the curse of dementia played by Anthony Hopkins with a heavyweight supporting cast lead by Olivia Coleman. I challenge anyone to exit without shedding at least a few years! Brilliant stuff and we'll deserving of their awards.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is how brilliant it was done that it will scare you by the fact that this is reality. Its been two weeks and I can't stop thinking about this movie. Its flawless in each act. I'm so thankful Sir Anthony said yes to this. I always had the understanding pf the disease but I could never grasp it intil I've watchdd this. Truly brilliant and a must watch.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: But so hard to follow. Reality is in my opinion the issue but is it the audience that has to make that distinction? I enjoyed it but left with no answers. Disappointed.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The most moving and haunting picture I've seen since... I don't even remember when. I poured my eyes out. This is a contained film, with small budget, the one that a debutant director makes, where all the money go into writing and acting. It's cinematography in the most pure form. The story is also intelligently directed, making yourself doubt throughout the film what's real, pushing the public to identify with the main character, living his tragic experience.The fact that Sir Anthony Hopkins, himself an 83-84 years old senior, plays a man born in 1937 named Anthony, makes the film the more soul-wrenching.Olivia Colman also gives a most powerful performance, showing her extraordinary acting range, from the light-hearted Hot Fuzz to The Favourite and now this. I don't have enough words to praise this picture. A must watch.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: One of THE best films Mr. Hopkins has ever been in! This story is exactly what me and my family watched happened to my Papa. In the last 10 years of his life he slowly slipped into Dementia and Alzheimer's. He never forgot who we were, but most times he wasn't even sure where or who he was. He would go from cloud 9 to irritated beyond all belief. And Mr. Hopkins made this part spot on. For the first time I truly understand what it's like to be in my Papa's shoes or head rather. And, when I realized what he actually experienced.. I bawled like a baby! Thank you to the wonderful actors and staff for giving this movie to the world. This is exactly what people need to understand for those who suffer from this horrific disease! This movie is a must see!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
I am speechless at Hopkins acting. My grandma was an Alzheimer's patient. Seeing the movie through an eye of a patient going through memory loss, I realized how traumatizing it would have been for her too. I didn't watch movies of other Oscar nominated actors but this acting was
beyond well deserved. Olivia Colman's acting was shattering. I was surprised to know its Director's debut.But can't forget the last scene. Brutal, heartbreaking and traumatizing. It will be in my memory quite some time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The script is good. The way of shooting is wonderful. The cast is amazing. Anthony Hopkins's performing is incredible.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Chrisblogger8g
3.5/4
The Father (2021)The Father is undoubtedly well-acted, well-crafted and densely packed with raw emotions, with the amazing performances from the two lead actors, Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman, and seems to work without a proper narrative. I myself got very confused watching Hopkins' character realize he was in somebody else's flat and then it is revealed he is in his flat after all, or how each scene transcends into eternal madness, ending up in a hospital, with characters that change names and appearances as if they were in a spinning lottery wheel. I would have appreciated if the movie was also presented out of Anthony's point of view, but, I guess, this is the brutal and realistic depiction of someone suffering from dementia.Other than Hopkins and Colman the other characters just revolve and are here to confuse Anthony (that's the name of his character) and the viewer more. This confusion was made on purpose, like I said, to depict a person suffering from dementia and how his surroundings and his 'fabric of reality' start to fade around him. We watch as the most sophisticated phrases like 'manage on my own' is repeated countless times, and how the plot sequences start to repeat later on in the movie, and mostly feel straight up from a Quentin Tarantino non-linear narrative.Here's one example: Anthony meets a caretaker that reminds him of his daughter, Lucy, whom he has no idea has passed, and the next day the caretaker takes care of him. A painting he has had for a very long time has gone. The following day, it is revealed that he had the meeting with the caretaker a day ago and the caretaker looks like the daughter he couldn't recognize about an hour ago when I first started watching it.Plot aside, I like how Anthony and Anne are characters that feel like actual human beings, one with emotion, feelings like grief, one that we can at least sympathize with and they make their intentions clear, through their actions. Anthony is just an 80-plus year old man who insists he can manage on his own. His daughter, on the other hand, thinks otherwise as he keeps on forgetting things and mixing imagination with reality, and suggests a caretaker.A side villain who is almost as convincing pops up and is in disapproval for Anne to take care of her father as he is a 'nuisance' and demands her to send him to an institution, which actually happens at the end of the movie. Is this man her husband? Has she met someone else? Or is she already divorced?By the end of the movie, Anthony is already unable to bear his everchanging circumstances and cries for his mommy, which provokes pity, sadness and sympathy to the viewer. It's agonizing and haunting.Tag it for a re-watch.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
In daily life, there are a lot of things that change very fast. We can't stop time, everything is changing around us. Sometimes a healthy mind might have be missed the changes or might refuse them. In this script, we see this changes through the eyes of an old man. The old man that can't adapt the changes as fast as the speed of change. There is no one reality for this man. He just splashes in the timeline and find out the thinks just he can remember. With magnificent acting of Antony Hopkins, we watch the old man's despair.
This movie shows us the world from point of view of the old man. It makes us realized how fast the world changes and how fast we are adapt the changes.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's such a great movie! You get a glimpse of what they go through and how frustrating and sad it must be. I loved it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I've always had a fear of death and growing old but this movie showed me just how sad and merciless life can be as you age, you get confused, you lose time and the worst you can't tell what's real or not. Anthony hopkins was practically made for this role, he delivered an oscar worthy performance that made me feel as if I was anne taking care of anthony. The helplessness and dread this movie invokes is amazing.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Boring. Boring. Boring. Thought maybe it would get better. It didn't.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film should be watched as a lesson/warning to help understand the curse of Alzheimers/Senility.My dad developed Alzheimers and over the years became a different man to the one I knew. It started with little things. He'd 'lose' his wallet. A couple of times he'd take the cash from Ma's purse and 'lose' it. He had worked as a plumber. One day I went to visit him. As I opened the front door I smelt gas. There was dad,in the front room with a stripped out gas fire,about to use a blow torch. That was the day Ma told me she couldn't cope and so I moved back home to help look after him. Slowly he got worse. He'd go out early in the morning for walks. Sometimes in just his underwear. Once he managed to leave the house and we ended up having to call the Police. They found him. I started staying awake most nights to watch him. I was already an insomniac. Watching him change from my dad into someone who didn't know me was difficult. The Dr's told Ma that dad needed to go into a 'care' home. We had to have him 'committed'. I have always regretted that. He was visited everyday whilst in the 'care' home. When he was living at home I had given up my job to care for dad and so I could spend several hours with him daily. We'd go for walks. Have a fish & chips lunch. By this time I was almost a stranger to him. Occasionally he'd think I was his brother. Though he always spoke of the sons who never bothered to visit him. Ma would quite often have to buy dad a new watch as he'd 'lose' them. The hardest part of this cruel disease for us was that dad,like the man in this film,had forgotten that his daughter had been killed in a traffic accident 20 years before. He'd often ask where she was. We never told him the truth. There were times when he became violent(something the illness seemed to bring out in him). Sometimes dad would have a lucid moment. It always surprised me when he called me by my name. Those were the times that became really special to me. I'd ask him questions about his life. Those moments only lasted a few mins. I used to wonder what dad would say if,during a lucid moment,I had shown him a video of the man he had become. I'm fairly certain he'd have asked me to put him out of his misery. He was always a very proud man.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: No doubt acting of each actor is good. But they movie is baseless and confusing. Monotonous and not meant for entertainment.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Different movie from the classics. Incredibly it tells of a situation that no one hopes will happen to their father. Sometimes you get lost and don't know if what you are seeing is reality or Anthony's imagination, great idea!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The emotional bond I did not think I would relate, but this film has shown me the real struggle of identity crisis and inevitable trauma. It hit me, a lot.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
I'm not really sure where to start! I've just finished stopping myself from ugly crying.I'm not going to give away any spoilers so here is 5 reasons to watch this movie.1. Outstanding acting by the entire cast
2. Keeps you engrossed as to what's actually happening
3. Anthony Hopkins!4. Olivia Coleman

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: About halfway into the movie, I suddenly realized I felt drunk or stoned even though I was actually sober. The script, the acting, the direction, the filmography - everything about this film created an immersive story that dragged me into Hopkins' character's mind. I vicerally FELT his character's confusion and disorientation. I literally FELT like I was drunk and stoned even though I was sober. I FELT like I'd lost track of what was happening in the film even though I KNEW I hadn't. Masterful!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I've never given a 10 rating. What else is there to say except.... what are you doing in my flat?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: ..."figure it out"; that's only SEMI-possible -- if at all: even the ending, for instance, can be taken at least 2 different ways, in terms of what's real & what isn't, given the condition of the point-of-view character (played to perfection by Sir Hopkins). No, I watched the film 3x in 2 days because it's so compelling. And yes, each time I perhaps "got it" a bit more, but more to the point, I got more OUT OF IT. This isn't "Memento" (another fine film); it's not a puzzle-ox to "solve." I suggest simply experiencing it, again & again, as your experience OF it deepens and broadens and thickens. MASTERPIECE.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This move is a great guide to those who do not understand dementia.At times it's a little scary that one may relate this to themselves. Anthony the powerhouse of the most realistic acting.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A masterclass in acting from Anthony Hopkins and Olivier Coleman in a movie which catapults the viewer inside the frightening confusion of dementia. A film that explores this highly charged, emotive subject from within and without, and never releases the audience from the ever-changing perspectives of that shifting inner landscape.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is easily one of the best films I've seen in a very very long time. Anthony Hopkins delivers an incredible and flawless performance. I can't imagine anyone else more deserving of an Oscar this year!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The story was boring, I check time bar in my player almost 100 times to find out how much i need to waste my time on this movie.Anthony hopkins was good? Yes, he was great, But this movie still was most boring movie, animation or TV Show i ever saw.Please please please stop over rate a movie just because of an actor.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Directed by Florian Zeller and based on his own play (with Christopher Hampton), The Father is, quite simply, a brilliant movie that deals with one man's descent into the world of dementia. Anthony Hopkins gives what is quite simply his greatest screen performance of his long career, and Olivia Coleman provides excellent support as his caring daughter. This is one movie that will stay with you long after the credits roll. The Father contains some of the best film editing seen on screen in a very long time. It's heartbreaking yet empathetic. A very strong contender for this year's best actor and best supporting actress awards. You must see this movie. Anthony Hopkins delivers a masterclass in acting.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What a powerful film. I can't even explain as it as I don't want to spoil it for anyone. But if you like movies about real life then it won't disappoint you.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My grandmother suffered from Alzheimer's and the film reminded me a lot. It treats the subject with respect and some bittersweet humour.It also used the unique properties of the medium of film to portray the experience of suffering dementia in an incredible way which I don't wish to spoil by describing it in detail.I would strongly recommend the film.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Brilliant acting by the two protagonists, father and daughter,but tremendously boring and without climax. It's a smooth continuous narration of the world seen by a man with dementia. I don't find that interesting. Why did we need a movie like this in the first place?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: "Father" is wonderful and watching it is recommended for anyone interested in cinema. Florian Zeller's solid screenplay, along with stage design, editing, spectacular filming, and the unparalleled acting of the film's actors, makes the "Father" viewing experience enjoyable. By making "Father", Zeller proved that there is no need for a third-party narrative to tell the story of dementia, and that one can see life through the mind of a person with dementia and feel what these people are experiencing. "Father" is by far the best work on dementia to date.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Let me start saying that Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman are absolutely brilliant in this movie and both deserve the Oscar praise they got, it's quite heartbreaking to see Anthony suffering like that, things already happened for him, others he doesn't even remember and everyone just doesn't get it, it's a great movie with great actors and a great story.10/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Really great movie, unfortunately in the family we have already had a loved one who has suffered from dementia, and this movie has just reminded me how she had acted, and can help to understand people who has dementia.Everyone should see.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: That's a rare thing sometimes. He plays the father exceptionally well. It grows upon you, it confuses you and you'll feel.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Might have been as well written by a literature student first year project. The whole painting of past events with future information as an quote artistic unquote way to explain dementia is somewhat arrogant.The actors made the film worth watching though.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Due to the closing of the cinemas, it has been a long wait for me to see this movie, and I'm, well... Not impressed. It's about an old man who's developing dementia, and a daughter who's struggling with the decision of whether or not she should send him to a nursing home. As a nurse who had worked in nursing home for sometime in the past, I can confirm it's quite a popular case in Europe, and it has also been going on for quite a long time. So since this drama wanted to be many things else, with sci-fi and mystery are among those, it forgot to actually present anything special to the situation, and became not so much worth paying attention to. It looks more like a backstory episode in a TV series than a movie, and the fact that it also leads to the inevitable, to the norm, it makes itself quite unimportant. I have to say I can hardly understand all the praise for this movie. Anthony Hopskins is amazing in it but as the story repeats a common reality, his performance gets old quickly. The only saving grace for it is probably the vibrant and excellent choices of opera soundtrack, but even with that, I was struggling quite much to finish this movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm rating two stars only because of the splendid acting of Anthony Hopkins, otherwise this movie would only be worthy of one star. Yes, it must be terrible going through dementia, which is the only point of this movie. Otherwise there is virtually no story-line other than the poorly executed teaser about the possible accidental death of Anthony's other daughter. I felt suffocated watching this movie and constant replaying of the same events over and over. While I absolutely enjoy all movie genres, be they comedies, dramas, musicals, etc., I do want to be entertained, enlightened, or educated, and this movie fails to deliver. Simply awful.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Defintely one of the best movies I've seen in couple of years ,this defines Anthony Hopkins as one of the genius actors of this generation.A truely and deeply affecting view of dementia and how it impacts the people around the sufferer.Highly recommended.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The last time I cried so hard for a movie was Lion and that was based on a true story. Everything about this movie designed to make you understand something that is so hard to explain, it is a more poignant version of Still Alice. The magical quality of the scenes fading in and out of one another takes you all the way to the end.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I watched it with my wife, and we are both in our mid thirties. My wife was in tears for the last 20 mins of the movie, and did I find my eyes wet, too? We were never so moved after watching anything. I'm glad I can still take care of my parents, and will keep doing so to the best of my abilities, until the last leaf!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I watched this last night and was totally blown away by Hopkins yet again. I laughed, I cried, I was confused, but the whole film had me captivated from start to finish.Can't recommend this enough. I don't like to give films 10's for some reason but I had to for this.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My short review will reflect the title of my short review: I didn't get the chance to see it in the cinema, but I watched it TWICE on a 10 hour flight from Heathrow to Dallas. This film hit me hard. Both in that I do have relatives who are suffering from dementia and Alzheimer's: please bare in mind that the condition Anthony has is never specified. But both of those conditions is known for confusing things for the sufferer, and the film is presented that way. It will mess with your mind but come together at the end. So sad, brilliantly written, beautiful film making.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Creative film-making techniques and extraordinary acting used to give some impression of the what Alzheimer's is like. It's hard to watch at times, as it must be. Might not be a good watch for people who have experienced the real thing up close, but it's eye-opening for the rest of us. It's also a really beautiful film. And Hopkins is amazing, as always.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It now seems incredible to me that never before a film had approached this illness from the perspective of the one suffering. It is a wonderful and harrowing view into losing your mind.You imagine how it might be for someone to lose their memory and be confused about reality, but this movie really manages to convey the real complexity of it. It gives you a perspective you never thought you needed and that you will never forget.Amazing movie, incredible acting, wonderful music and perfect pase. Truly a masterpiece.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is so good. He deserves all the awards there are.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I wasn't sure what to expect from this film thinking it would be a depressing story about an aging parent. However the story being told was done in such a unique way and it kept you guessing as to what the truth was. Also Sir Anthony's performance was mesmerizing and brilliant and I was emotionally involved in the story. See this movie, you won't be disappointed.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Brilliant! Clearly oscar prize chances!!! Fantastic story!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Uncomfortable truth about the future that awaits us all. Brilliantly shown perspective from a person with dementia. Marvelous acting.Sad but good and true, we need more movies this good.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Yes, I get the subject matter hits home for some but the truth us thus could be a 15 minute short film. Standard Hopkins acting which us good but not Oscar worthy. The story is non-existent. I'm baffled that anyone would actually like this movie. As entertainment it is totally boring.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is my favorite actor, and he deserves all the Oscars out there in my opinion. But I just didn't like the movie, dementia or no dementia it was such a boring movie. At least I watched it for free, otherwise I would want my money back.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's really rare, especially these days, to watch a fantastic work in all aspects..!A great artist who embodied elderly in way u feel it emotionally since it happened exactly the same to someone u love!Gorgeous work! .. one of my best movies that I've ever seen..!Frustratingly, didn't take what it deserves unlike some other garbage ones..

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins absolutely deserves this Oscar. His perfomance is not just great, its shocking. He made me understand how bad and frightening a mental disorder like dementia is. I'm really scared in the idea of being in Anne's( Olivia Colman's acting is also very good) place and have to go through all of this with my father. Overall a great and touching story everyone has to watch.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A deliberately confusing movie depicting the confusion dementia causes, brilliantly told and directed, and above all absolutely astonishing acting from Anthony Hoping. After watching this you will definitely be worried about growing old.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A beautiful depiction about the process of aging and how ones memories begin to fade. This is a story of a daughter and her father who are both going through the journey of age and the senility that comes with it. The story is entangled in what is both the father and the daughters journey of this loss of connection. I think this movie is very important to both the young and young at heart who really need to understand that our memories are fragile and we must make every opportunity to ensure we enrich other with as many good memories as possible.Olivia Coleman gives such a beautiful performance as the dutiful daughter whose love for her father is to be commended and how one copes when there is are dark days in caring for a parent who is slowing loosing the grip on reality.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I really have been straggling for hours to find the truth behind this movie. The idea and the whole consept is incredible I'm really confussed and it's made me feel that I had amnesia. I still feel it cause I haven't understand what is the truth about Ann, her husband etc.Although, it's not the meaning of the movie to understand what really happened but how Anthony feels and what he thinks. We frequently see him to look for his watch and I think this is symbolism for trying to remember when all these things happened. His memories is so messed up and some of his thoughts may haven't had happened at all.The scene where he is crying and he wants his mommy like a little boy it's really intens. The nurse calls him "baby" and tell him that "everything is gonna be alright" like a mom would do. I think about it and it really breaks my heart.No words about Anthony Hokings one of the best actors of all times. He should definitely win an Oscar. Olivia Coleman is very good too.In colcusion, this movie it may be one of the saddest things I have ever seen but its masterpiece. The actors, the editing, the directing they are all wonderful.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It is the best movie in Anthony Hopkins Film History.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I suggest you see this movie.with an extraordinary acting of Anthony Hopkins.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins with his very subtle skills shows how dementia really feels like..pure class acting.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Haven't seen such a good movie in ages. First time I rate 10/10.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A year ago if I have to recommend a movie about Dementia and Alzheimer, Still Alice would have been a very easy choice. Somehow, that movie stuck with me since I was a kid and it broke me in a very good way.The Father though... it left me so devastated. You don't just 'watch' this movie, you 'EXPERIENCE' it. The Father will make you know how it feels to have dementia. How confusing and frustrating it would be. Anthony's fear of abandonment is the most heartbreaking part of the movie. On top of that, every little joy that he had, it lasted very short and we all know that it will be gone. At least the movie gave us a chance to hug him at the end but left us wondering which is reality or which is Anthony's scattered memories or was he in the hospital all this time?Just only Anthony Hopkins's acting is already made this movie worth watching. A masterclass without a doubt. On top of that, it's amazing how well this movie tell its story. The camera angles, costumes and the script are so refined. The flat designs are also worth mentioning. 10/10 for sure and probably one the best 2021 movie so far.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Antohny Hopkins shows that he really deserved Oscar. His performance carries the movie. That does not mean movie would be not satisfactory without Hopkins's performance. Movie itself has great storytelling , cinematography and cast.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Sir Anthony Hopkins deserves all the accolades he gets for this most deeply personal performance in, The Father. This is one of those first movies that delves into what is involved in dementia/Alzheimers patients. Sir Hopkins takes us on this journey that involves confusion, memory loss and burden. We are taking his footsteps, on his way, into this confusion world he's been sent to live, much without his knowledge or consent.I had to pause the movie to contain myself 😢 because Anthony's performance was on par with genius. His very moving journey into the road of dementia/Alzheimer leads us to a road of Netherland, and then to pick up the pieces afterwards.You may not be able to switch off after the movie ends, but Anthony's performance 🎭 will thankfully stay on for others to watch in awe.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The acting is a masterpiece of chambre play magic. The cinematic engine put to work with what it does best, to image the cognitive process, to allow us to experience rather than watch from the outside the disintegration of the self, until its constituents left like rubble on the floor, early childhood, melancholic or show man, characters alternatingly appearing out of thin air in the spiralling mental rewind. And the saddened realization of all the missing time, all the gaps, the five years obviously lost between anne being martied and going to paris without a minute passing, the years of not seeing lucy felt as months and eventually the time gap from being an infant with a mother to being an old man with a daughter perceived as simultaneous. The film medium is strikingly well suited to depict this breakdown of time, chronology and causality, because it is the editing language by which we read film, hence his lack of mental grip over these becomes our frustration and our lack of comprehension, and yet still we can cinematically also read what he is left with - an association montage, scenes linked by resemblance only.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The father makes you wonder if dieing at a young isnt better.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Not sure how anyone could give this movie a good review. Tried watching again after wanting to bash my head into a wall and left me wanting to do the same again! Boring and dreadful!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The story broke my heart, it reminded me of what will happen when we get old.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins at his finest!!! This film sucks you in to the point you don't know what's real and what isn't. Leaves stuck there and your feel for all the characters!ACADEMY AWARD for Hopkins!!!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I had.a Grandpa who suffers.from dementia for years and actually passed away last year on October 21st, watching this really made me tear up in many scenes, Sir Anthony Hopkins performance is brilliant, the way he struggle to put on his shirt, how he keep forgetting people he meet the other day, even someone that really close to him, how he had hallucinations, and he think someone tried to harm him, how he keep talking about someone he really love and really wanted to see that person so bad even though he can't, oh i can relate to almost every single thing that happen in this movie to my own grandpaand finally, when he become acting like a baby and start calling his mom, that one hit me harder than the rest because my own grandpa actually saying the same thing, how he miss his father and mother whilst crying endlessly in his bed, oh grandpa how i feel sorry and i know it's hard for you to spend your final days suffering like that, but we can't do anything other than to take care of you as best as we couldI'm glad that we didn't actually send him to nursing home, we just can't, that's too sad to even think about, at least for us, and he actually passed away in peace and in complete silent early in the morning, and to tell you the truth, i'm actually glad that he already passed away, it means his suffering is finally over and leaving this cruel world behind, i can't keep thinking about how happy he is right now to finally meet his friends, his mother and father up there somewhereRest in peace Grandpa, you are gone, but will not be forgotten, and we love you foreverAnd thank you again for your.beautiful performance Sir Anthony, been watching your movies for years and i must say, this will be my top 3 favorite, you truly deserves the best lead actor this year.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm out of words. What can I say. If this isn't a masterpiece then nothing is. This is the best movie in Oscars 2021.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins extraordinary acting notwithstanding, this is the darkest, harshest and most insensitive portrayal of dementia I've ever encountered. While I appreciate the unusual viewpoint and the attempt to convey the experience of the person with dementia, it is a very partial view at best.Having lived with dementia in my own family as well as working with dementia patients professionally, this view is incredibly distorted. Most people who have actually cared for someone with dementia would not characterize it so darkly. There are beautiful, loving, and yes, many funny moments. Dementia is always changing with varying degrees of lucidity--which was not shown in the film. And while there may be despairing moments, dementia patients often feel quite jolly. In other words, they have a full range of feelings just like anyone.But what really stung about this movie was the insensitivity and selfishness of everyone around him. Neither the daughter nor her boy friend had the slightest clue how to respond to someone with memory loss. Their insensitivity was painful. The carer was more on target, and the nurse at the end finally came through in a loving manner.If the intent was an empathic portrayal of dementia, the result falls far short. The scenes where he was a bit jolly fell kind of flat against all the despair and darkness.Dementia, which is a progressive malady, is increasingly and incredibly difficult. And yet, everyone I know, myself included, who has stuck it out with a loved one considers it one of the most rewarding experiences of their lives. Even if it does become necessary to put someone in a facility, it is so important for the loving family caregiver role to continue.This movie could have been so much better if it had been better researched and consulted on by people with actual experience.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I finally got around to watching The Father and it was an absolute revelation. An acting MASTERCLASS from the giant that is Anthony Hopkins.First, let's get the elephant in the room out of the way, I ADORED the late Chadwick Boseman in Ma Raney's Black Bottom, and I too, sung his praises the moment I saw his incredible performance, but whoever's on Twitter saying Hopkins doesn't deserve the Oscar is either pretty dense or hasn't seen either films. The two performances could trade blows until the end of time, but at the end of day, it's Hopkins' subtlety, and the confidence in his craft that he effortlessly puts out that bring it home for me.The film is a rasw and honest look into a world virtually unknown to anyone on this planet, at least not completely accurately, visited only by an unlucky few who never got the chance to tell the tale. A dollop of humanity that shakes you to your deepest core. An experienced I wish I'll never get to witness first hand, or any hand for that matter.My most encouraging slow claps to Florian Zeller for a smashing directorial debut.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Hopkins' best performance after Silence of the Lambs, and I realized that he was perfect in the roles of strength and weakness. And He has given us something to live like the old people and looking to the way they going to thinking and looking And the way they see juveniles makes us afraid of getting old. Hearing stories about elderly people is not the same as living like them.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie lets you understand Alzheimer's disease fully and flawlessly. This movie made a big change in my life and it's a lesson to be kinder to older people who have lost their strength through time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I am almost eighty, and, though I found the film riveting, I also found it confusing. Like Anthony, I couldn't work out who those strange men were. And the music was far too loud, even though I have 'hearing difficulties'. (Is everyone deaf now ?)As I went upstairs to bed I felt that I too was suffering from some form of dementia or other - even though I'm not.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I read the reviews marking this movie 10/10 and I had my doubts, not until I saw it. It brought back my grandmother's memories, by the time I didn't know it's a sickness, I just thought she's been difficult to handle, and with her attitude thinking she can't stay with anyone little did I know that she equally didn't know what was happening to her. Wish I had seen the movie the time she was alive. Rest in peace grandmother. Hollywood thanks for the movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I just finished watching The Father. Its ending made me cry a little. I'm only saying this to signify how uneasy it can be.It's difficult to write about this film immediately after seeing it therefore I'll keep this post short and casual.Firstly, it's a play adaptation and it is visible that the film is kept in the spirit of the stage performance. Setting is fairly static, performances strong and the film language limited to the realist-impressionist style.Secondly, this film really does a great job showing how the dementia might feel for the ones affected with it the most directly (the ones who actually suffer it, inside their heads). Mixing times, faces, events, places while still trying to keep the bits of own identity as well as to make sense of the happenings progressively lacking in the immediate coherence is painful to watch from a perspective of an informed spectator, knowing what is going on - contrary to the main protagonist of the film - and having had witnessed similar illness in the past.Finally, my purely subjective view on this film is that this the film and the performances that should be talked about. After Quo Vadis, Aida? The Father is another 10/10 film and together they highlight the mediocrity of relatively popular, recent films such as Sound of Metal and Promising Young Woman which for some strange reason seem to get the most of critical as well as public attention this award season.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Actuslly I'vent been soo indulged with all this saddness and heartbreaking emotion in such a movie , I've been reminding myself while I'm watching this , thats its just an acting and its such a movie , really Antonio Hoppikins and Olivia were extraordinary in delievering the idea of this movie , I think its an oscar for Antonio.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins my favourite actor ever.My father suffered memory loss only a month before passing away but Anthony the character in this movie seems to have had memory issues for years it's not quite certain but this movie is clever in making you feel like you are Anthony seeing life through his eyes .It made me cry at the end and if you don't I'd be amazed.Best film I seen in years deserves all the high ratings.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins, take a bow! This is the best hes been in years. The film is beautifully shot, it really conveys a sense of place and the direction keeps everything ticking along nicely.You can't help but become invested in the father character and try to unravel events as they happen. Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What I appreciate most about The Father is the choice of narrator - who is telling the story? This leads to the questions: How sane are they? How confident are they in this? And how confident should we be that this is true?The film progresses with a sense of temporal dysphoria. People come and go, disappear, change names, change faces, change attitudes, and sometimes, events completely contradict one another. However, our character remains confident in his sanity, and instead reacts to this seemingly changing world with hostility, some of which falls on his own daughter.This is a powerful example of how changing the reference frame from which a story is told can paint a clearer picture. Often, we watch mentally unstable characters through the eyes of others, and in our minds, create the association that that character is very odd, in comparison with our narrator, the other person. If we instead tell the story from the point of view of that so-called mentally unstable person, then they are completely sane, yet almost the entire world around them is incomprehensibly peculiar. Which of the two stories do you think emphasises the extent of the psychological disorder? In the case of The Father, it is by far the latter.The movie ends with a touching soliloquy, which probably secured Hopkins his Oscar for the performance. "I feel as if I'm losing my leaves" he cries, as he begs for his mother - as a man in his 80s. In the end, our character finally admitted that he was ill, and for a brief moment before the end, things seemed normal. We can hope that he came to terms with himself, and found some sense of peace, in the days he had left on this Earth.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A punch in the stomach. A film that shows the struggle of people suffering from Alzheimer so realisticaly that makes you feel uncofrotable.A movie i wouldn't suggest to sensitive people with relatives who suffer from this difficult disease. Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm really surprised that some don't "get" this film, especially those who say they were confused. The filmmakers declare exactly what their intentions are very early, and we get to feel the pain of a family unraveling from dementia. Others complain that this doesn't exactly depict their experience with the topic. Don't listen to these reviews and see this film ASAP. It's a uniquely brutal look at a heartbreaking ailment - and it will stay with you forever.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Not sure how too sum it up. Stunning performances. Both my parents suffered from dementia, this film hit so many of the experiences we went through in trying to care for them.We were in tears during the film and after, I think we relived our experiences. Masterpiece of cinema.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Leaving the theater, I felt as if I was the one that had dementia. That's a near-certain mark of the movie's success.It's wonderful to see such success from the playwright directing the film based on his play. Florian Zeller supplements his all-too-real end of life tale with timely artistic shots (the painting, the broken face sculpture, the tree full of leaves) and brilliant use of perspective. This is dementia from the sufferer's point of view.Anyone who has spent time around a person slowly losing touch with reality has seen the paranoia, the misplaced confidence, and the fear - each displayed by Anthony Hopkins with unparalleled realism.If you have lost someone or are currently caring for someone with this condition and you know that experiencing it will only cause pain, this movie is certainly capable of bringing pain. But if you want to let the magic of movies show you what others experience - what it is like when you cannot trust your own mind - then go see THE FATHER.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is a rare unrepeatable actor who has performed a difficult role for those of his age.As for Olivia Coleman, she is an actor who can get an Oscar with only facial features and expression.

Title: THE FATHER

Even if they are patients with dementia.Thanks to Mr. Hopkins for his acting in this film is too perfect.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: There is not much to say about the movie. Title: THE FATHER
Comments: First of all Anthony Hopkins really nailed this movie with his acting skills. I don't think that anybody else could have done a better job than Anthony did. This movie gave the viewers a close look to someone who struggles with dementia and did it very well. The viewer was as confused as the main character was and we could fell empathy for the old man. The ending was satisfying and beautiful.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: An invaluable road map into the mind of the disappearing person you once knew, it gives you the fuel to carry - and care - on.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film provides a compelling and moving portrayal of the onset of dementia (or potentially Alzheimer's) by its lead character, masterfully played by the legend Anthony Hopkins. What I really appreciated was that the story is told from his perspective, and you can feel his sense of confusion, loss and fear of having to let go. What was also depicted in an honest and nuanced way was the relationship between the parent and the child-caregiver. Olivia Colman did a fantastic job of conveying a sense of moral ambivalence between having to constantly take care of her father or to move on with her own life. While she does eventually take the decision, motivated in part by her partner, her lack of resolution is clear and her sense of guilt is relatable to anyone who is or has been in a similar situation. Really enjoyed the film.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: We watched many films about Alzheimer's disease and dementia, but from the eyes of the people surrounding the patient himself, here in a movie we see the disease from the patient's point of view, we deeply sympathize with him and remind us of the people we met who were suffering in the final stages of their lives. Outstanding performance by Hopkins and excellent directing by Florian Zeller in his first feature film.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Brilliant. Sad. True. Human. It is ruthless, as it should be. It is uncomfortably familiar. Brilliant.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: While watching 'The Father', I thought the dialogues were completely unrealistic. How could the daughter be surprised by the father's reactions every time... She knows he is demented.But then I thought about this as one of the really great things in the movie: It's all the perception of the father. It's his reality. The one that is mixed and confused. What a great movie!!!

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: One of the best movies of this year.Both Oscars are absolutely well deserved!The screenplay is so original and the actors' performances are all stunning.This is a different way to tell a story that will leave you as disoriented and surprised as the main character himself.Sometimes I kinda felt like watching Memento by Nolan, even if we're talking about really different things.Its strength it's in details and originality.Not for everyone.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: After watching this movie, I have an idea of what dementia patients suffer and let me just say that I don't wish this fate on anyone I hate.Anthony Hopkins brought such a beautiful and realistic performance to his character. I felt like crying a couple of times, that's how moved I was.I hope many people watch this movie and when they do, I hope they learn to be more patient with Alzheimer and dementia patient. They are really suffering.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Unexpected! You don't see such things coming, you start watching and try to understand what's going on but then you figure out there's nothing to understand! This's literally the opposite of understanding, this's what disorientation and incomprehension looks like! The whole experience defies your need to understand, which beautifully, brilliantly and in the saddest of ways delivers what dementia means and feels like
An extremely well deserved 6 oscar nominations especially Sir Anthony Hopkins who couldn't be more demented!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Lets start this review with Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman. They make this film to a masterpiece, brilliantly subtile in their acting and in the twists and turns of this drama. But all the actors in the film is making a great performance and becomes a perfect conducted reflection of the sanity and craziness that comes with the sickness of dementia.The film is based on a stage play and you feel it in the dialouge that is both poetic and emotional without being overacted or to obvious.The film has a nightmarish feel to it without losing the warmth and depth of the human relations.The sadness of getting old or see someone you love get old is in a tender way portrayed by Hopkins and Colman all the way to the very moving ending.Hopkins acting in this film should be a must to watch for every young actor or actress that want to know how to be convincing and true on screen.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I've never written a review before. I'm a big film buff but no matter how good or bad a movie is I just can't be bothered. This film has made me bother. Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My mother suffered from vascular dementia.First I was afraid to see this movie, but the performance of the actors was fenobinable. Not emotional, but real and sometimes a bit of humor.It is quite an experience to see dementia through the eyes of the person itself.I recognised several things, it's a terrible disease.The end was heartbreaking, I looked away.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The experience of watching someone deteriorating from their perspective is powerful and important. Suddenly someone's behaviour while getting older begins to make sense.Hopkins Greatest Horror Movie Since Silence of the Lambs.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I hope Zeller moves from the theatre to film full time because this thing is sublime. Dementia (Alzheimer's disease) runs through both sides of the family, I've seen the disease full throttle. It is nasty and heart-breaking; it destroys everyone around the person suffering.I've a big soft spot for almighty performances. I get a buzz off seeing an actor harness everything in their being to master the craft (DDL in There Will Be Blood; PSH in Capote, The Master). Hopkins is 83; he delivers an absolutely abnormally outrageous performance. One in which, if you're watching it right, will linger long after. It's mesmerising.But to oversell on the acting alone is to do Zeller a disservice. Coleman is also great. The film and its script (adapted from the stage) is just beautiful. It sucks you in, allowing you to fully realise the disease in all its terrible, and dare I say it, funny, contradictions. I wouldn't want to spoil this for anyone. I reckon you should go for it; the worst that can happen is you turn it off after 20 minutes when you realise it's not for you. It was for me. Utterly brilliant.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Just saw "The Father". Wow! Movie of the year. Excellent performances by all, especially Sir Anthony. A very sensitive, emotional journey through the mind of age. Expertly written and directed. In every aspect has it succeeded as an extremely moving and revelatory portrayal.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: When I think about all time great performances, I think about Marlon Brando's Vitto Corleone, Robert De Niro's Jake LaMotta, Tom Hank's Forest Gump, Daniel Day Lewis's Daniel Plainview, Jack Nicholson's R. P. McMurphy, Dustin Hoffman's Rain Man and, of course, Anthony Hopkins's Hanibal Lecter in Silence of the Lambs. And with no fear to make an overstatement, I can easily say that an 83 years old Anthony Hopkins did it again.Hopkins's performance is technically perfect, very emotional and powerfull. The result is a character with diferent layers, that is not just a man with a disease, but a man who once was charismatic, intelligent and proud. His struggle to not be able to be that anymore can be noticed on his lost look, his pain and in the solitude that his condition holds him. The intensity of all this fellings is brought to us in a raw way that just a great actor can do.And although Hopkin's performance is the main factor of the movie, it isn't just that what makes The Father a great movie. The editing is a crucial factor to creat confusion and imerse the audience in the main character's perspective. The screenplay is able to make the family drama comprensible as well the fellings of the diferent characters, besides all the confusion we are all imerse. And last, but not least, Olivia's Colman's great performance just makes the movie a more powerfull experience and reminds that this dificult situation can be lived by anyone who has an aged parent.All these makeThe Father a necessary, unconfortable and powerfull experience.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Can someone please tell me the point of this movie?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is a difficult film, difficult to experience and even more difficult to digest. And that is precisely why it is a brilliant work! Another theater play brought to the cinema, as it has been in fashion lately, but what an extraordinary way to do it. This is the film that answers the question that we all must have asked ourselves even for a brief moment: "what would it be like to live with dementia?" Through the direccional choices we are transported to Anthony's mind and, consequently, confronted with a distorted perception of reality which, no matter the effort we make to understand, ends up being incomprehensible.The film lives and dies by its interpretations (like any good play) and Oliva Colman and Anthony Hopkins are at the peak of their game. Olive with a measured, smooth, but meaningful interpretation; Hopkins in the best performance of his career (and that's saying something!) shows us everything he is capable of, starting the film full of layers that will be removed throughout until nothing is left, the confidence and charm that we know of so many psychopaths that he's portrayed until the vulnerability of a small child and with everything in between.The director only admitted to making this film with Anthony Hopkins in the main role, hence the name of the character, and we can understand why.When, at the end, you hear the rustle of leaves as the camera flies over the park, we are left with a thud in our hearts and are overwhelmed by the fear that one day we will be able to experience in ourselves what we have just experienced on the screen. Still, this is an exercise that we should all do, everyone should see this film.Deep, Touching, ... Terrifying, here is: The Father.Undoubtedly the Film of the Year and the Interpretation of a Lifetime!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I understand that film expresses many experiences and tells many stories, some fact and some fiction.This is a story of fiction. But don't be fooled because it is very possible and very real.I wonder how films like this can be viewed with much of any pleasure or ...entertainment.Cause after all what is film of not to tell a story to amuse or intrigue. And well there can be expressions of violence and gore in some film, at least that expression is perhaps more blatant.As I found this film to be disturbing and sad.You are pulled into the main character, Anthony's life as he loses his mind to dementia. In a setting that ultimately becomes a world that has no time for such insanity. Where people get taken somewhere, and put away, to let someone else deal with them.That reality is very real. And more horrific than any gory horror film.Anthony Hopkins who plays the character of Anthony, is a great actor, but he could likely be just playing himself, as he has reached an age when losing parts of ourselves is the reality. And so I don't see it as an award worthy performance. But who am I to say and well I'm certainly not involved in all the politics that go into those ceremonies.Watch it, if you're curious. Most will probably feel some sort of complaisant agreeability with the story. Empathize. And you only have to seen the news or followed along any social media outlet to see that people revel in the discomfort of others.Makes you wonder.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Going in to watch this, I knew this film would resonate with me. Anthony Hopkins gives an absolutely stellar performance of a man suffering from the hourly/daily kaleidoscopic twists and turns of dementia. I absolutely loved how the film was able to depict the confusion and warping of time from the father's point of view.From his insistence that someone was stealing personal items, to his staunch refusal to leave his flat, it all too keenly reminded me of the last chapter in my mother's life. The final scene hit closer to home than anticipated -- so painfully, but realistically captured. Brilliant.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father; the film ends and the cinema auditorium is silent, a very sombre atmosphere. That's because it's an extremely emotional film, I didn't cry in the cinema but I did when I was alone in my car. Anthony Hopkins is incredible, as is Olivia Colman and the supporting cast including Olivia Williams and Mark Gatiss.It's a disorientating film, hard to know when one scene ends and another starts. Often there is repetition of the same dialogue, altered through slight changes in setting and major changes in character as seen through the eyes and mind of the father. I'd say it's one of the most original films I've seen, in terms of its structure, both in the way the story is told and how the audience along with the father is unsure of who's who. It very much reminded me of Michael Haneke's, Amour, in places, especially the inner city grandiose setting of the flat. Florian Zeller is the director, who also wrote the screenplay from the play the film is based on, which Zeller also wrote.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: My mom died last year, in 2020, six years after being diagnosed with Alzheimer's. She had lived with us for 15 years helping to raise my kids, and it was nice having her be a part of our family until the very end.There are many things in this movie that just don't comport with the reality of how a family deals with a family member with Alzheimer's. Good families know how to de-escalate situations, and to create a safe environment for the family member with Alzheimer's. You don't question or raise doubt about something they should have remembered from yesterday. It does not help. This includes the end of the moive when Anthony gets the full attention of his nurse caregiver who is there even to go on two walks a day with him. Based on my experience with multiple memory care facilities in the USA, that level of care is simply not to be found. When I checked my mom into facilities for short respite stays, the cost is very high, the food, and quality of care is marginal at best. No one gets individualized care. One place left my mom in a wet bed all day. If it were not for my business trips I would have kept her home all the time.If you wanted to create a movie that showed how hard it can be on a family to care for someone with Alzheimer's they could have showed changing wet bedding every day, or the struggle of getting them into a bathtub to take a bath. My mom would cause ringing in my ears from screaming as I try to give her a bath. Bottom line, this movie was not very true to the reality of the situation family members face.However Anthony Hopkins did a tremendous acting job worthy of his Oscar winning performance and the cinematography of this movie was amazing. It was very inventive how the scenes worked to confuse the audience and give us a sense of what Alzheimer's is like. For these reasons alone the movies deserves a viewing, even though I found it frustratingly removed from the reality of caring for someone with this horrible disease.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Okay, he has dementia, but why are all the characters changing? Who is his daughter? Who is the husband/boyfriend? Why does he end up in a hospital magically? Its like more of magic shape shifting scenes that is a full of repeat scenes and boredom.PLEASE save your time and skip.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father, Finally a (new) great movie about an illness or condition that is not just focused on appearance and third party observation of the illness, but it brightens up the experience of the person engaged with the problem and the aspects of someone living with dementia specially around what's most important which is mostly our relationships and dear ones.The writing of this movie is just great with every dialogue and rotation of camera that should be closely watched.Next is just Phenomenal and in tone music, really helping to connect to each part from the composed soundtracks made for the movie to each song selected.And last lets just stand and give a big round of applause for Antony Hopkins that proved age in cinema is no effective element on acting and toward that great legends like DeNiro, Pacino, Hofman and etc are just not taking it seriously enough as they did once.An outstanding, definitely Oscar-Worthy acting (which I highly believe he will win) by Hopkins and really good ones by other actors and actresses.A movie highly worth watching and one those Masterpieces that wont age thorough time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: No movie before ever took you by the hand this way through the meanderings, red herrings and scary dead ends of dementia. Writing and acting doesn't get any better than this, sorry. As if Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman had anything left to prove, they just proved they kept getting even better.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father is a good movie and depiction of dementia. It is heartwrenching to see an old man lose his sense of reality and how this effects his daugther.This movie really plays with perspective as we see the confusing life of a man with Alzheimers. Altough its done on purpose the whole movie is quite tedious, nothing big really happens and there are no real plot points except the disease and paranoia of this man.The acting is absolutely top class and this movie can really evoke emotions, but at the end of the day this is not my type of movie as I found it quite boring and annoying at times.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins just made the best performance for an old man I have ever seen on the screen. His acting was so actual that I forgot this was a movie and started crying. And It was never a one-good-actor movie, everyone who performed in this masterpiece was incredible. They were so good that ,sometimes, I doubted them, too (along with Anthony) . And there are no words good enough to describe the amazing soundtrack of the film. It touched me deeply in the moments of doubt, sadness, despair and, most of all, truth. What's really special about the movie is that it descusses a real life issue that we all see and hear about every day. And just picturing the agony of these old people is torturing. Imagine what it would be like as your world falls apart around you, as every minute passing in front of you does nothing but assure you more of your inability, as you hurt the ones you love most by just wanting to live on your own in your flat . That's what generates the great collapse of (I need my mommy to come and fitch me) in the end. In conclusion, I just want to say The Father made a great choice when it decided to capture the father's point of view.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This was a cleverly crafted film, with a great script, acted wonderfully, particularly by Sir Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman.As a viewer you experience the confusion of Anthony as his condition impacts on him more and more. The first time you experience his shift in reality it comes out of the blue and is so unexpected. The shifts in time and characters give you a taste of what he is experiencing as a result of his illness.The final scene is truly heartbreaking.You have to see this film!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm a Geriatric nurse and as such, I see a lot of Alzheimer's and Dementia patients. This film is by far one of the best depections of Dementia that I've ever seen. The plot feels disoriented but it's a purposeful disorientation as you realize that's what these patients feel. Names, faces, and memories all become jumbled. Alzheimer's patients do not experience time in the same linear concept that we do, and this movie captures that so perfectly. Sir Anthony Hopkins does a masterful job of bringing us into the mind of Anthony, an elderly gentleman suffering from Dementia, and Olivia Coleman captures the emotions and trials that her character, Anne, must endure as Anthony's daughter and caregiver. I hope that every medical professional sees this in order to help us provide better care for our patients, and I hope this brings a greater understanding to the public about those suffering from this illness, leading to more acceptance and a kinder world for us all. This movie is a must watch as it will keep you in your seat, and keep you guessing every step of the way. I'd also like to take a moment to explain that while not every person with Dementia may be this way, a large part are. There are different versions of Dementia, with some patients not gaining lucidity the way Anthony does, and some patients being completely pleasant in manner and mood. However, all the characteristics of the illness portrayed in this film are accurate, are not dramatized, and unfortunately are very real for millions across the globe. If you or someone you know is suffering from, or caring for, someone with Dementia, please call 1-800-272-3900 for support and services in your area.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm not the type of person to write reviews about films and watch films like these but this movie really really hit me in my emotions. Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Coleman did such a good job in this film it really pulls at your heartstrings. Definitely hits the point of what it is like to live with a parent with a disease like this.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: In my opinion, THE FATHER deserve oscar's Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Editing, Best Actor, Best Actress!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony hopkins is just brilliant, truly deserved oscar. The movie itself is just perfect, fresh, well tought! Will get you into a dementia/alzheimer case. Just go and see it!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is a film that stays with you. Of course there's the brilliant performances but there's more. While other films have taken on old age and dementia, those films took on coping with a significant other's condition. The difference here is that the film is from the sufferer's perspective. You therefore see these events as if you yourself have dementia. And it's stunning how, when you walk away, you know you can.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins easily the greatest actor of our times in his gut wrenching portrayal of a man suffering from Alzheimer's. Seamlessly expressing ranges of humanity from Hannibal the monster in The Silence of the Lambs to his latest nominated role in The Father as he slowly slides into the horror of this father as he loses his mind witnessed primarily through his caregiving daughter portrayed by the brilliant Olivia Colman. The sliding in and out of his past and present flows beautifully through the steady direction of writer/director Florian Zeller an acclaimed playwrite from France, breaks your heart, terrorizes you as you travel through his life's trauma giving way to his rage as it seethes through every expression from a long life survived as he's losing his grip on reality. Nominated for 4 Golden Globes.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: More movies like this and sound of metal should come so that people can understand the lives of the people suffering from these diseases.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Must-see movie, but you really have to be in the special mood to watch it.After watching it for the first time I was confused and sad, but wanted to watch it one more time.It presents the dementia in really strong and realistic way. I had two family members who suffered from dementia and these moments showing Anthony's obsession with the time (watch), mood swings, different feelings about his 2 daughters..., are so realistic and presented in excellent way.I watched the movie two times and after every watching I had different impression, different thoughts about what is reality...many question marks above my head.And Hopkins performance is just incredible. My reaction at the end was "I do not want to see him like this" 💔

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It made me rethink my own sanity. It made me think of my mother's death. The movie confuses everything. He does not forgive and does not spare the viewer. Even break the fourth wall. I even thought that the crazy person was the daughter. Anthony Hopkins is amazing. But the time signature of the movie is too slow. And the movie has no surprises.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Before watching this movie, you should know nothing about it (literary nothing) 'cause movie leads congitive, mental and emotional process. At the very begining, you question the need of caregiver. As soon as you get it, you are in the process. Then you catch what is his imagination and what is real. And then you catch that there's no real, everything is in his head (or maybe not, but it doesn't matter). And then, when you finally understand that the whole movie is his imagination, you face the repeated dialogues: repeated, but in different circumstances, and now they have more different meaning (doesn't we, who don't suffer from that diagnozis, do the same? Remembering is variable thing...).

Title: THE FATHER
