Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This is the film that hooks you and dont let go until the final shot. Sir Tony is just incredible in this one. His character is loveable, relatable and has that charm that, in spite of dementia, still shines through him. As the title says, he plays the father of adorable and caring Olivia Coldman which is in mine book, after seeing her astonishing performance, one of the best actresses in the world of cinema right now. She is soo good in emitting emotions to the screen that she could do that with her mimicking alone, no words needed. Seeing sorrow in her eyes while looking after the man who raised her is just hard to watch. But the preformanse at the end of the film given by the veteran of cinema sir Antony Hopkins is just OUT OF THIS WORLD. I never felt that way while watching a movie. It was like a giant stone was pressed on my chest and i started sobbing like a child, first time after untimely death of my father 10 years ago. Thanks God I watched the movie alone. Anyway, cinematography and direction are great, also the script, lighting and music. And, no matter witch "political correct" movie get Oscar this year, for me will always be this one..

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I started watching this movie because of it being nominated in the Oscars. This movie will go on to haunt me for quite sometime. Hopkins acting truly makes him deserving of an Oscar. My grandmother is suffering from forgetfulness and this reminded me of her a lot. A very emotionally powerful, and beautiful movie. Must watch for anyone who has a closed one dealing with dementia to look at the life from their perspective.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Simply the best film I have seen in a long long time with not only a masterclass from Anthony Hopkins and exceptional performances from Olivia Coleman and Olivia Williams. However it is the writing by Christopher Hampton and Florian Zeller that makes this a masterpiece.For anyone who has witnessed a someone close suffering from dementia, this will be a tough watch. It's not hard to appreciate how difficult it is for A family watching their loved one deteriorate day by day, going from being a bit absent minded and forgetting where they left things to no longer recognizing their spouse or children. The Father takes us on that same journey but from the perspective of the sufferer and once you realize that, it rips your heart in two.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie was fantastic! Tremendous acting by Anthony hopkins,at times the movie even has you wondering what is happening. This movie does a good job of showing you what dementia/ allzheimers can do to a family.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Getting to watch Anthony Hopkins in "The Father" is like going on a journey with the main character as he experiences and develops the symptoms of Alzheimer's disease. Although we recognize the theme of the story from the beginning of the film, the aggravation of the Anthony's situation leads to more and more contradictions and nonsensical scenes towards the end of the movie, and perhaps this is mainly because we are seeing the outside world from Anthony's perspective. The movie is humble and doesn't convey a feeling of ostentatious directing, acting, etc, to the viewers, though Hopkin's performance is splendid. Really enjoyed watching it!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie really rips your heart out!No happy end, no hollywoodish over dramatizing, just the sad truth about dementia/alzheimer with outstanding acting!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The same film done 5 years later. Watch the original!Florida (2015 by Philippe Le Guay)

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: When I started watching an Oscar movie with the incomparable Sir Anthony Hopkins I didn't know what "I'm getting into"!The Father -2020 is a film that does not make you feel good but makes you deeply sad, it makes you go through all the possible states and even makes you think that ... you never know what fate is preparing for you!Quite static (taking place in 3-4 rooms and a long hallway) the film becomes dynamic due to the fact that the action takes place, in fact, in the ravaged mind of a father with Alzheimer's.Incredible and terrifying is the illustration in images of the darkness in the mind of a confused man: the plans overlap, the rooms change, the characters are or are not what they seem ... everything is unclear ... and in the center of all is always him, the old man with a confused and confusing smile on his lips.I don't think he would have been another better actor for this role. Even the writer / director Florian Zeller didn't think otherwise, offering the script since 2017 to the great actor and refusing to make the film without him (the character's name is Athony because it can only be his) Ffff inspired choice because Hopkins is masterful! Merit that was recognized this year with an Oscar (the actor has another for Silence of the Lambs - 1991) being the oldest actor who received this distinction at 84, dethroning him (if you can say that even though everyone has well-established place in the panoply of great actors as well as in our hearts) Christopher Plummer who was awarded at the age of 82.Olivia Colman (as Anne's daughter) is slightly overshadowed by Hopkins' overwhelming personality (who wouldn't she be ?!) yet she plays a wonderful role.The film also has parts in which music plays an important role, Hopkins being a great lover of classical music and even singing the piano. The area from Bizet's "Pearl Fishermen" was chosen for the film at his suggestion, being one of his favorites.I don't think there is much more to say about this film (it "took my maul" anyway as they say) and I don't even know if it would be good to recommend it to people who have old or sick parents or to young people who don't he would (still) understand its depth."The Father" is such a realistic movie that it's good to put on a list and watch only when you have the necessary mood but ... by no means ignored!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Movie is brilliant, it confuses you at first then realize that's what every old man suffering in his old age.. it made me feel very sorry on each strong man has defeated by age.. Man keep his powerful and dignity mixed with losing memory..
Movie also tell us to be patient with our beloved old people and any rude action is not in purpose.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I just recently lost my grandmother to dementia... I have seen plenty of films depict mental deterioration, but this one is spot on.There were times I uncontrollably wept. This gave me such a haunting perspective on what the last few years of my grandmother's life was like.I will probably never watch this movie again. Because of how accurate it felt.10/10.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Hopkins is mind blowing!! What an absolutely incredible, heartfelt & gut wrenching performance, beyond outstanding, without doubt the performance of his career & simply one of the finest performances in cinematic history, seriously!Olivia Colman is great too & gives a very nuanced & subtle performance as she always does, the rest of the cast give admirable performances also.Very well written, directed & beautifully shot this is a truly great addition to the world of cinema, thank you to all involved.WARNING!!! The end scene will break you.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I rarely take my time to write reviews on IMDb and this is a clear exception. One of my biggest fears is slowly losing my memory and not being able to recognize the people I love wholeheartedly, and this movie made sure I cried a river of tears throughout the beautiful journey of watching it. Anthony Hopkins is, without a doubt in my mind, a fantastic actor who helps this movie shine. The story is phenomenal and, at one point, I legitimately thought I was watching someone suffering from Alzheimer's.If the movie didn't throw the word "Anthony" at me every now and then, I can be certain that I wouldn't even remind myself that that man is Anthony Hopkins.I always see actors and actresses but I also allow myself to establish an emotional connection with their characters.There are very few movies that I have watched where I completely forgot I was watching a movie, and this is one of those movies. I got lost in the movie as Anthony got lost in his mind. In the very end, I didn't see Anthony Hopkins, I saw an old man suffering from a horrible disease. I sincerely hope Hopkins gets an Oscar for the genuine tears he spawned on my eyes.It's a beautiful film and you won't regret watching it!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This movie was phenomenal. It's a drama played out like a mystery thriller due to you being in the mind of Anthony Hopkins's namesake character.You can tell this was a play due to the minimal locations throughout but it suits it, the flat almost becomes like a metaphor for his mind, more and more like a labyrinth as the movie goes on.Hopkins and Colman were both incredible, both of them should have won Oscars but Hopkins could have won it ten times over. It is a heartbreakingly accurate portrayal of dementia and worthy of all its accolades.

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I am astonished at this film's impact and the effusive praise for it and the performances. I had to keep ff-ing rather than abandon it, but it didn't improve. My problem is that I have worked in neuropsychology, and especially with dementia, over many years, and this rendition is lacking lacking lacking. Hopkins didn't impress me nor did the script or anything else. Utterly boring and not, to me, authentic, however, when so many of the general public seem to draw something from it, I can only defer to them. Dementia is a much more exciting and interesting condition than portrayed here.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This film makes you live everything the people who suffer from dementia are feeling. It's amazing and in the same time so heartbreaking to be so tormented by your own mind and memories. You feel confused, lost, it makes me appreciate caretakers more, how much humanity is needed for this job, it makes me sad for the families who must see their loved ones slowly fading away and becoming child again. This sad film makes me happy that these profound motion pictures still exist today. Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Coleman deserve all the awards , they are amazing.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
If it's unavoidable for a tree to lose its leaves, all we can do is to be a good gardener as possible as we can.It's the most touchy film I've watched these years, but have to say, it's still a touch story under the white and privileged background... reality can be so much more graphic than the film
However and whatever, it doesn't affect how meaningful and thought-provoking this work is to me.Life is like a circus, we're trying so hard (or at least I'm trying) to perform the perfect balancing act every single day. I think Anne already did a great job. And when I become Anthony one day, I probably also will feel so strengthless. But this is life. Despite how much torture and surprise it holds, it's still life. I respect and appreciate it.Salute to the Father, salute to life.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
How does one respond when they cannot know reality? This is the main question of the Father.The Father is adapted from director Florian Zeller's stage play by the same name. The story centers on Anthony (Anthony Hopkins), an aging man who slowly loses his grip on reality due to dementia. His daughter Anne (Olivia Colman) does her best to care for him, but she too has a life she wants to live-her boyfriend Paul (Rufus Sewell) has asked her to move to Paris with him. Anne struggles to find an aid who can handle her father, so that she can get on with her life. Zeller shared that his inspiration for the film was watching his grandmother, who raised him, pass away from dementia. You can feel the emotion coming through every part of the film.The movie starts with Anne confronting Anthony for chasing off the last assistant. Anthony claims he did it because she stole his watch. Anne patiently reminds him that he put it in his hiding place. She goes and finds the watch in his "secret" hiding place. At first, we are able to chuckle about the situation, but we soon become just as confused as Anthony. The tone of the movie shifts when Anthony stumbles upon a man in his flat who claims to be married to his daughter. He waits for Anne to return from the store to sort things out, but when she arrives, she is a different woman entirely.The rest of film has confusing moments like this. Once you think you have sorted things out, they are flipped again. I watched this at the premier at Sundance, and during the Q & A after the film, a woman asked if Anne went to Paris with Paul or not. Zeller responded that we don't know that answer, the answer is not what is important. Zeller stated that he wanted us to be as confused as Anthony and give up on trying to sort things out and just feel. And feel we do.Anthony Hopkins performance drove the emotion. His masterful control of minor expressions and vocal nuance intensified the whole film. I would not be surprised if he wins best actor next year. Zeller admitted that he named the character "Anthony," because he wanted Anthony Hopkins to play the part. (The part was literally written for him.) Anthony's emotions swing in the film driven by his loss of memory and disorientation to events. Everyone seems to be on edge, not knowing how Anthony will respond. One moment he is happy, the next he is distressed. This comes out strongly when Anthony meets Laura (Imogen Poots) for the first time. Laura is a young woman who Anne has set up as Anthony's new caregiver. Anthony begins telling Laura how he used to be a tap-dancer. The scene is funny, and Laura laughs throughout. Suddenly, Anthony remarks that Laura reminds him of his other daughter, because of her inane laughter-and the mood has swung.The key question in the audiences mind is "What is reality?" Zeller disorients Anthony and the audience by having different actors play the same characters, then switching back. Zeller rearranges the same apartment, so we are unsure where we are-Anthony's apartment or Anne's. Anthony tells different versions of his career, and we even seem to experience events out of order. The only thing we are certain of is that they don't even speak English in Paris!This is not to say that there are multiple realities, but that Anthony cannot access what the true reality is. As the audience, we become like Anthony-confused. We do not know what his daughter looks like or if she is married. If she is, which man is her husband? However, this confusion over reality is meant to push us beyond discovering the truth and just feeling the helplessness of someone suffering from dementia. And to this point, it works.But, it takes us beyond this. By the end of the film we are all confused. We cannot access what reality is, and now it is time for us to ask, "How do we respond?" The film has its answer, but I'll leave it up to you to feel if you agree. This is one film that has to be watched to appreciate, because it focuses on the feeling of the experience and not the truth of the experience.A couple extra notes:
First, Zeller shared that the classical music that Anthony listens to throughout the film is Hopkins's favorite music. Hopkins always wanted to be in a movie that used this music, and now he got the chance.Second, often movies adapted from stage plays can feel very confined and unnatural to the screen. Events that would naturally lead a character elsewhere seems to falsely confine them to that space, since the play needs to keep them there. However, Zeller does a nice job at expanding the world and making the small space feel new. Most of the film takes place in the apartment, but because of the rearrangement and use of different rooms in the apartment, it feels larger and natural.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Father is a very good surreal movie right in the service of the script The surreal atmosphere of the film rotates in the direction of the story and is related to the story of the main character of the film and he was able to use this space correctly. And the great play of Anthony Hopkins, who, in my opinion, offers the best creative role after the silence of the lambs. Scene design and cinematography are very well done in the film. In general, the father is a good movie .

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Dark... dark like staring into an abyss, maddening and heart-rending... terrifying too!Especially since you watch it from the perspective of the person suffering, as he slowly and steadily starts loosing the thread of his reality and as the movie progresses, you become him... You suffer the same dementia, the same confusion and the same muddled reality until you start to doubt yourself... is Anthony the one suffering or is it you yourself?By the time the movie nears its end you feel as if an invisible hand is twisting your gut and something heavy has landed on your heart... something which is going to stay there for days...maybe weeks!It was almost 30 minutes after the curtains that I started crying and shivering uncontrollably... I just couldn't stop the tears... I decided I will never end up like Anthony, I would rather commit suicide than loose my leaves I... that was the kind of terror I felt...!To say something about the acting would be like showing the torch to the Sun itself... Sir Hopkins with his mannerisms and eyes root straight for your heart and stays with you like a spectre... haunting you...Before you watch it, be prepared to get moved... considerably so!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I very seldom, actually never, review movies or tv series on web sites but I do feel that this requires some comment. Although this is a very disturbing film, which is brilliantly acted by Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Coleman, it has really opened my eyes to the pain of mental illness of people at an advanced age from both points of view. Not only is the anguish of the family very clear, which is what most movies of this genre focus on, but it also gives a clear view of what the patient is going through. An excellent film.

Comments: Anthony Hopkins... what an actor my goodness!! He's...I can't even explain how great an actor he is. And Olivia was flawless. Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm writing my first review ever, but it deserves. My mom - God bless her soul- suffered dementia and Alzheimer's disease years before she passed away. I remember how all family members suffered while taking care of her. Alot of delusions, hallucinations and paranoia. Should one believe in his senses ? Or in his beloved ones? I realised that time that mental disability is much worse than physical disability. This touching movie is telling the story for the first time from the other side. I think I'll watch again soon I feel like I miss watching it again and again.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: What a dipiction of one of the most mysterious disease of our time and what a misery it surfaced about the haunting situation these patients are bearing with. Exceptional script, direction and out of this world acting by A. Hopkins. Now I know why Robin Williams did that !........:(.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: "The father" does not talk only about dementia, it talks about life and about growing old. In the final scenes of the movie the door opens completely and human fragility rushes inside your soul and mind. This movie starts quietly and it slowly takes your whole heart as the story makes clearer and as you put the pieces of the puzzle together.Other movies simply described dementia and old age, from an external point of view. This movie instead is seen within the eyes of an old man who is losing touch with reality and who feels more and more dazed and scared and this is an extremely original prospective.The acting is powerful and Anthony Hopkins is simply great.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This could've been the story of my mum. I wept silently through most of it wishing I'd never gone: it was at once deeply insightful and searingly heartwrenching. Anthony Hopkins' performance was seamless. He is a master craftsman of his art. So accurately observed. Every breath, pause, glance, step so precisely delivered. You could almost feel his thoughts and confusion. Would I recommend it?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: If Anthony Hopkins doesn't win an Oscar for this performance, there is something incredibly wrong with their awarding process. You would almost think this could be some mind twisting thriller, but its simply a movie about the deterioration of the human brain with dementia. I think everyone should watch this to gain some perspective on what it's like to age with dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The movie is so well written that even we get a glimpse of what it is like to live in Anthony's world. I have seen movies where they portray dementia but this one really gives you a real dose of what it feels like just by watching the movie, kind of like what memento felt.My grandmother is suffering from Alzimers and I have always wondered what must be going through her mind. We celebrated her 87th birthday few months ago and last week I visited her, I asked her how old she is, she replied 63. She would go on to tell me about her childhood for the hundredth time but I listened like it was the first because she is always so invested in the story that she literally cries and laughs when explaining her stories. As it was getting dark, she would try to get up from her seat saying that she needs to hurry and cook some meals, as her son will reach soon from work. She'd try to get up and say the same thing..She hasn't entered the kitchen in decades and hasn't seen that son in a decade, he passed away 11 years ago.Do watch this movie, it will hit you like a brick wall if you are just getting about dementia and will knock you out cold if you have a relative with the same condition.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It was a risk seeing it. My mother died of dementia, and attempted to be her main carer for several years. I empathised with Ann's grief, the constant need for her to be there, and the denial that any help was needed. When Anthony looked out of the window, and watched the boy playing, I saw my mother latterly still looking at children with delight. The confusion, mood swings, paranoia, bitterness and bizarre behaviour was so brilliantly conveyed by 'Anthony'. So real.The obsession with time... How did he manage to convey the emptiness in his eyes? So glad to have seen such an incredible film. It will stay with me, but in a positive way. G.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I've never cried so hard while watching a movie. Anthony Hopkins has always been my favourite actor, but this movie will leave a lasting impact on me. One of the best movies ever made. Hats off.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Best film I have ever seen. Absolutely deserved the Oscar for Anthony Hopkins!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'am sorry, I have to give this movie little rating, because it has too big. This movie should be rated 6/10, then I wouldn't even bother with this movie. It is boooring! Of course it is confusing when it is from perspective of person who has dementia. Such a bad concept. Man, I want my 97 minutes back! I have a headache.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I am working with people struggle with all kinds of dementia 15 years. Watching this movie was like another hard day at my work. I am glad if someone decided created movie like The Father. I have hope more people will understanding have difficult but wonderful work we provided every day. Is hard for the patient, for staff and for families.Thank You so much. Congratulation to Sir Anthony.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: As someone who had to deal with his grandfather having dementia in his final stages of life, the depiction of Anthony Hopkins felt truly real and moving for me. This movie will help you understand better this disease and what people go through when their mind start to deteriorate.His winning at the Oscars was totally deserved, this was one the greatest performances in his career.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The movie shows you the suffering of Alzheimer's. From the sick perspective.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: BEST BEST BEST. Made me cry so hard! Anthony Hopkins is the Best actor of all time.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Looking at the trailer before I watched the movie, I knew it was going to be good. I just didn't expect it to be that good! Loved every single minute of the movie. Can't wait to watch it again.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I was drawn to see this film having memory issues of my own, and with an octogenarian parent living with us. It was for me a most uncomfortable experience requiring a stiff drink afterwards to quell a strong sense of foreboding. There were only 4 or 5 couples in the cinema but all were silent through the final credits, remaining sitting as if not knowing what to do next. Highly recommended but not if you are over 80.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I hesitated watching this. My dad (and I, by extension) have been living THE FATHER for a few years now. Our lives intersected that of Olivia Colman, Anthony Hopkins and Rufus Sewell. The confusion, misplacing of everyday items, immense sadness over the unfairness of the condition, Dad's insistence of events that hadn't occurred, helplessness and depression from the helplessness that was felt- we've lived it! Did I really need to see this in a movie? YES. It was cathartic. It was necessary. How Anthony and Olivia conveyed the emotional turmoil that we had experienced(and continue to) was what I needed more than I realized. I hadn't yet cried out my frustrations and heartbreak- until this evening. Beautiful movie.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'd had a particularly bad day visiting my Dad and wasn't really in the mood to go to the cinema let alone see this film. My defences were up before we'd got through the adverts.To start with I thought that this was OK but not brilliant. But the combination of a strong cast and equally strong script soon drew me in.By the time you realise what's going on, you are totally consumed in the nightmare.Some of the dialogue and mannerisms could have been my own dad earlier that same dayThis is a hard watch for anyone who has family with dementia. And as others have said will stay with me for a whileWas it brilliant. Yes. Would I want to see it again....have a feeling I will but not yet.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This will hunt me for a while... Devastating thing that already took so many great people...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I never weeped in my life like this before. Such a very authentic heavy drama. Like seeing the absolutele difficult day to day life from an Alzheimer's patient. Best drama.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Hopkins is an extraordinary talent. It's great to see him in this complex character. Undoubtedly, this movie is unforgettable for me.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Just because the acting was good doesn't mean the movie was. It was the most boring thing I've ever endured in my entire life. That includes my 83-year-old mother and my 65-year-old brother watching it with me, we were all falling asleep. I cannot understand how this accumulated so many high ratings.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The film was so well done you could easily forget it was a film and get lost in the personal hell along with Anthony. Truly a Titan in the acting world and he earned that Oscar for his performance.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: All the movie I was just crying!The best movie that I've ever seen, I recommend everyone watching it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father looks at the subject many families face each day. Heartbreaking to watch at times, but the compassion is there, if you look. Sir Anthony deserves an award for his portrayal of the main subject in this movie!! Enjoyable acting by the entire cast.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: When the Doctor ask Antony when was his birthday? Antony says its 31 December 1937, the exact date which Anthony Hopkins was born.No wonder because the script and line was written for anthony himself.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Knowing family like this you suddenly see it from a different perspective
Very cleverly you are in their position
A film you will never forget.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
A movie that makes you think of yourself, your parents and your kids at the same time,
And if you were lucky you will remember your grand father...A movie that am afraid to recommend to my parents, as much as i want them to watch the miracle of Anthony Hopkins performance yet am afraid of its affect on their emotions...Its just one of the best movies i ever watched.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Very emotional, moving, and well made as directed movie played by the Phenomenal actress Anthony Hopkins.No dry eye left in the cinema hall, Wonderful!!!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: A closely observed and compelling journey into dementia which manipulates time and place in order to express the anxiety of the sufferer(s).The closing scene's beauty is matched by its tragedy, and it left me stunned. Unmissable.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins is finished the acts on the big screen by his role in this movie. It is as usual performed by the lonely Anthony made me crying.He must have the Oscar this year.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: It's one of the most impressive movies I've seen. Fading out from life could not be better described. Also, words are not enough to describe Anthony Hopkins' outstanding performance. This movie can also be played as a theater, its single place form and character transitions are very suitable for this.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I was on my flight to Burbank Airport while watching this. I usually don't watch films like this and did not know what I was getting into.But I was pleasantly surprised I really liked to see the inside of this terrible disease Alzheimers. In a way I think it can prepare you for what might come to some or prepare you to research as much as possible to prevent it.Anthony really played his part so well. The look of confusion on his face and his beats he took, stumbles on words was so true! And the last few minutes really had me in tears.I recommend this highly.Oh I also loved the fact it was just shot at their home and then a small bit at another location for the end.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: As a 77 year-old man, I found this film to be the most depressing, scariest film I've ever seen; rivals 1951's The Thing From Another world, when I ran out of the theatre.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Really really good.Love the way the film narrates and confuses you, but in a good way.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Inception but not si-fi. Great acting. Looking forward to more Florian Zeller directing.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I was debating whether to rate this movie 1 or 8. It's certainly really touching and disturbing. Anthony Hopkins is great. But why shoot a movie about a decease? It's kind of like having a movie about a patient with a progressive cancer. Dementia is a decease, so is cancer, and other serious illnesses. What's the idea of dedicating a movie to show the agonizing effects of a decease?

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This has everything except car chases, zombies and the other ridiculous special effects of modern cinema. This film feels Shakespearean and epic in its profound emotional appeal and comment on the human condition. I was scared, hopeful and sad and very, very confused - in one word, my emotions were running the gamut and I was hooked. At the end I cried like a baby :). And - I love you, Sir Anthony!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Incredible performances, it's just a new level of acting not seen before. Leaves you speechless and in tears. Hopkins is a true genius. The cast, music, script, shooting, ... just ... wow.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Father will leave you feeling melancholy and hopeful at the same time. Whilst the story is heartbreaking, the love, grief and compassion Olivia Coleman's character radiates through the movie depicts perfectly the real struggles of dealing with dementia. This in combination with an outstanding performance by Anthony Hopkins gives life and depth to an otherwise simple plot line. As an audience the rug is constantly swept from under your feet, Florian Zeller constantly subverts your expectations and brings you into Anthony's world - Simply Brilliant!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I had been waiting to watch a 'good', well made movie for quite a while now in this lockdown era. But, most movies which have been releasing lacked something or the other. The Father has had last fulfiled that desire and I recommend everyone to watch it.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I didn't cry for years even in my worst days even in the most tragic moments nothing could make me cry. Anthony Hopkins did, that's it that's my review.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: This one hit me soo hard. What a performance by the Legend Anthony Hopkins. Old age is the last phase of one's life and one cannot but deny that fact that they become little children again. This movie is soo well depicted and thought off and especially shows the puny life of old people in the Western Countries...What class acting and direction. As much as I loved the movie, I doubt I will have the heart to watch it again. Thats how good Hopkins was...Especially the last scenes where he asks for his Mommy...

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I saw this film and thought about my family's experience and my grandmother. She had Alzheimer's and almost the same story. An aunt took care of her until she passed away. In the movie they didn't capture the full progression, at the end of my grandmother's days she forgot how to move and how to swallow and she was intubated so she could stay alive. I feel like I owe a great debt to my aunt, she gave up her job to stay with my grandmother full time.As for me, I am very sad and emotional after seeing this movie. I moved to another country just before she died, I had a special relationship with her, I was her first grandson and lived with her when I was little, she spoiled me and I was very dear to her. I loved her and I really miss her. The weird thing is that in my mind her funeral was the day I read about her illness, I hugged her and wept, she was so confused and kept asking what was going on my son.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Compelling and wonderfully acted film, which evokes questions and emotions you won't be able to shake of. Anthony Hopkins is completely outstanding.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I watched this on the eve of my 60th birthday. Dementia is something that has an increasing presence in day to day life and particularly when you are approaching my age!It was so interesting to see the view from the "other side" which really made this film amazing to watch. I shall watch it again because that will increase my understanding of the whole situation.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: To walk through what they experience is a eye opener.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: And then you get Anthony Hopkins in THE FATHER. This is a devastatingly, heartbreakingly-brilliant performance and a great film. Hopkins' range is incredible. He goes from charming and funny to menacing to wholly lost in seconds. From man to child on a dime. It's a powerful rumination on a terrifying disease, bolstered by Sir Tony at his finest, a strong supporting turn from Olivia Colman, and an excellent script by Christopher Hampton and Florian Zeller (based on Zeller's play). It's a daring move to tell the story from the perspective of Hopkins' character as his mind increasingly deteriorates. A savvy one too, as the audience is forced to engage to truly understand what is real, who is who, and where precisely we are in our protagonist's gut-wrenching journey. This may be Hopkins best work, a late-career revelation that once again reminds us why he's one of our finest cinematic performers. Be warned. If you've ever been touched by the tragedy of dementia, this film could wreck you.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Clearly a powerhouse performance from AH, but the film itself felt thin. As a study of dementia, it certainly disorients but it just felt monotone and boring. Where was the plot that is driven by the core story device of dementia.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: For Best Movie and the Actor..along with the screenplay! A masterpiece.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments:
Anthony Hopkins portrays in a fantastic way how life erodes, piece by piece, when dementia takes over an old man's life.
Olivia Coleman, who plays his daughter, shows with greatness how painful and sad it is to see her loved father slowly disappear into the fog.
The film really grabbed me and tore my heart apart.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Anthony Hopkins's performance was stunning. This movie shows you some facts about life and it does it in very touching way.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: Do the right thing Academy! There's plenty of other ways to honor Chadwick Boseman. Don't let wokeness prevail over merit and common sense! Sir Anthony Hopkins gave the best performance of the past 40 years in Lead Actor. Do the right thing!!

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: I'm totally lost for words! There's no words in the world can describe this masterpiece, Anthony Hopkins acting skills in this movie is beyond human capabilities, something never ever seen before.But beware, this movie is an emotional bomb that will leave you devastated and some scenes in this movie will hunt you till the last day of your life, so better don't watch it, and I mean it!

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: The Silence of The Lambs, Fracture, Hitchcock, and The Elephant Man were all amazing performances by Hopkins but The Father is the only film of these that truly makes you forget your watching a movie. The fear, confusion, frustration, depression, anger, and brief lucidity experienced by dementia sufferers is something many of have seen, but even for those who haven't, his performance is so convincing it throws you into the middle of what a child experiences when their parent is battling the disease. There is nothing like this film. Watch it now.

Title: THE FATHER
Comments: OK we all know the actors here are fantastic. That said, what the hell was the point? Dementia is bad? Thanks for that news flash. We get no sense of the arc of the character's lives. No real sense of connection to what is going on beyond a heightened sense of terror that we all might find ourselves in this condition. Also the $20 fee to watch this interminable cinematic root canal feels like a complete scam. Why is this the one movie I had to buy versus rent? What a waste of my life.
